Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel good for young couples”
Reviews.Author: Patsy_Wong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and we had a good experience in this hotel. We booked the room type with bed on lower level but were given another room type with bed on upper level when we checked in. The reception said it was an upgrade. As the bed was on upper level, there was plenty of space on the lower level where we could move around and placed our suitcases and things we bought. The shower area and the toilet were separated. Also the shower area is quite small (but clean and modern design though) and you don't have much space to place towel and clothes inside. Since we are going as couple there wasn't much inconvience or embarassment. But if you are travelling with friends and you are not very familiar with each other, this may not be a ideal choice to you. The stairs climbing up to the upper level are reasonably safe. You just need to be a bit cautious when you wake up in midnight to make sure you watch out your steps. However overall the hotel and the facilities are all very new and stylish. The bed was also very comfy and we felt we were home. We enjoyed our stay there. One more thing, the location of the hotel is not close to the MRT. The Clarke Quay station is at least 10-15 minutes walk along the river. We tried it once and couldn't accept the distance when our stomachs were still empty in the morning. So we used taxi and the hotel shuttle for the rest of the time. The hotel shuttle is a one-way trip and departs every hour on the dot so is still acceptable. And since it's close to Clarke Quay (10-15 minutes walk), you will find lots of choices of restaurants/pubs at night.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puneet B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Studio M was was my first foray in Singapore back in 2010. Since then, whenever i visit, i make my reservations in this hotel only. Not too far from clarke quays or orchard road but a lot less noisy and a lot more peaceful. Good food, good service and a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy”
Reviews.Author: chrischant
Reviews.Content: Clean cool mid budget hotel. Slightly kooky mezzanine design. Nice staff, good pool area

Reviews.Title: “Utter rubbish - one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. Ever!”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to staying here, having previously read good reviews and having thus far not found a consistently good mid-budget hotel in Singapore. I booked through my account with Booking.com and did not initially realise that this hotel was part of the Copthorne chain. At checkin I was presented with a card pre-filled out with something vaguely resembling my personal details from a previous employment, even though my Booking.com reservation recorded all my correct details - apparently, once you are "in" the Copthorne system. they have you, and, arriving close to midnight, I had to fill out the registration card again longhand. The hotel is set one road back from the river in a reasonably central location - 15 minutes from Clark Quay MRT, but walkable to e.g. Bugis, Raffles Quay and Chinatown. The hotel appears to be 10 - 15 years old, with an attractive outdoor dining area adjacent to the open-air pool. The breakfast buffet was good by most standards and was included in the room rate, as was wifi, which was reasonably fast and completely stable. The rooms are split level but truly tiny, rendering the downstairs no more than a corridor to the upstairs sleeping area. Toilet and shower cubicles are also tiny, the only washbasin is in the "main" downstairs room and the previously mentioned glass partition on the balcony is indeed more than slightly scary (with no non-slip tread on the stairs either). The sleeping ledge has a sign over the bed warning you to mind your head - it's that cramped up there. I was staying with my teenage daughter and had hoped that we could share the split-level room, but it was far too small and when I discovered that the room was non-refundable, I was forced to book a second one for her. There is a hanging rail but no cupboards or wardrobes. Room service is allegedly 24 hours, but even of you can get through on the phone, you'll discover that it only opens at 6pm. I reverted to dialling the hotel's external number (which was answered immediately) after failing to get through to either Reception or Room Service on the internal phones, and when I went downstairs to complain there were 7 members of staff idling around. When I used my mobile to again call the hotel external number, one of them picked the phone up immediately. I made a complaint to the Manager, but she really didn't want to know. When Room Service does ultimately arrive it is delivered in plastic buckets - not food containers like you would get from a takeaway, but semi-transparent deep extruded buckets with plastic cutlery. Both the Sausages & Mash and the Chicken Lasagne were vile and luke warm, though the Lamb Shank was ok - all priced at $15 + 10% Service Charge. Beer and Iced Tea at Sing$8 per can from the minibar When I checked out there were numerous additional "Room Service Charge" items, over and above the "Food & Beverage" charges which I recognised. I was initially told that these - each around S$17.50 - were a local Tax, but when I pointed out that GST Tax was itemised separately, they admitted that this had nothing to do with food & beverage, but was an additional "service charge" for using the room. In other words, a mandatory house surcharge, making the room 10% more expensive than the headline rate. This kind of gouging is plain cynical, and calling it a "Room Service Charge" is borderline deceitful, as many people would not notice it. The staff were consistently unhelpful, and I seriously would not recommend this hotel - nor indeed any in the Copthorne chain - to anyone looking for mid-range accommodation. I stayed for 4 nights in April 2012 at an aggregate cost (1 room) of S$1,000 - the Swissotel Merchant Court is far better, more central and would have cost only S$1,300. It would have been a wise investment from a number of perspectives, and I will not make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: RomaPHILE33
Reviews.Content: This hotel styles itself as a boutique hotel. The loft style rooms are cleverly designed because having the high ceiling above the bed makes what is really a very small room seem larger than it actually is. The shower is on one side of the entrance to the room and the toilet is on the other side. Both are very small. Really not much more than closets. The bed is hard up against the outside wall. No room to walk around the bed at all so if the person on that side wants to get out they're clambering over the other person. The bed was however the most comfortable bed I've slept in in a hotel anywhere. One last thing, believe everything you've read about how cold the air conditioning is.

Reviews.Title: “impressive”
Reviews.Author: gakz
Reviews.Content: The check-in process was efficient, as there are clear labels at the reception desk indicating 'check-in' and 'check-out' so that really helps lest someone gets in the wrong queue. The staff were all friendly too! Location wise - it's about 2-3 stops away from Clark Quay MRT. Walking from the hotel to the bus stop takes about 5 mins, and the bus ride to the MRT would take another 5-7 mins. I was really impressed when I first entered the room (I believe mine was a studio loft). I really love the high ceiling and it gives the illusion that the room is very spacious, although it's a little smaller than average. The nice design and unique concept makes up for the space I guess. No complaints! the bed was comfortable for a good night rest. I thought the ambience and lighting on the walkways to the room were really well conceptualised, bearing in mind I don't usually take notice of such things. Didn't manage to eat the complimentary breakfast provided though. But there're plenty of eateries around the hotel so food shouldn't be a problem! Overall, my experience at Studio M has been a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashlj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights, the hotel itself is lovely and the room is a great layout. There was loads of hair left everywhere on the sofa and in the cracks of the bed but other than that it as very clean! The staff were all lovely apart from one lady who I think was the manager or supervisor she was very very rude! Location was brilliant easy to get to anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: YoursSincerely_RT
Reviews.Content: To make it simple, I will be listing it down in point form Why it is horrible 1) room had a horrible musty smell - I tried 3 rooms and all 3 were the same and no! The smell was there for the 1 day and 1 night stay 2) the idea of a nice Sunday breakfast is absent - Limited choice of food that taste worse than cafeteria food with limited replenishment. Terrible wait staff service 3) front desk service is terrible - slow in taking action for 1) , slow in response and terrible customer facing skills. Bad response as well... 4) 1) to 3) says it all. The only good thing 1) the housekeeping gentlemen were very well train in customer service more so than front desk 2) same goes for the door man. Excellent customer service skills 3) both the housekeepers and the door man was the only savior and they make it worthy of the 1 star given. Conclusion Studio M seems to be in the league of the hotel 81 chain and no more. Go for it if u r comparing between the 2. Sorry studio m but I was utterly disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “creative n quirky but less practical”
Reviews.Author: Maura-SoeparjadiKwik
Reviews.Content: First impression, interesting. The concept of a hotel room masquerading as a studio loft definitely came across creative, and quirky. After staying in it for 1 night however, I find the concept actually a bit less practical. Upon check-in, the receptionist told me I got an upgrade to a premium room, a gesture that I appreciated very much. Downstairs is the living room, sink, and the toilet/ shower that are separated. Upstairs is the bed and TV. The unit was clean, but the tabletop by the sink was heavily stained. The toilet area was very very small. I’m of average frame, and when I sit on the toilet, my knees practically touched the wall (so you have to sit a bit diagonally ha ha). The shower was of decent size and the water pressure was very good. The bed was amazingly comfortable! The dark colored stairs though can at times feel a bit slippery/steep when you are going down. I don’t feel it’s safe to have young kids stay here. The glass protector on the upper floor says “do not lean” and it does feel that you should not lean on it. The hallways felt cramp and a bit dark. I would have preferred better lighting in these areas. The view was awful. My room was facing another side of the hotel. The hotel is not located in downtown/city center/Orchard Road. But it is very conveniently and strategically located within walking distance to Clarke Quay/Robertson Walk. Lots of very good dining and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely loft rooms. Quaint and cosy.”
Reviews.Author: LimJJ
Reviews.Content: The room is so quaint and cosy. Double storey loft style gave the hotel stay a fresh feel. The only drawback is the small bathroom. U can hardly move about inside. Not cool at all. Other than that, it's almost perfect. Breakfast was pretty sumptuous.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Spot”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl47
Reviews.Content: I spent three night in March at Studio M and really enjoyed my stay. I think the all loft concept is very unique and I enjoyed that it really felt different from the majority of hotels I have stayed in. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are a bit compact, but I still found it to be very functional. The bed was insanely comfortable as well, which was a huge bonus. I would recommend requesting a room with the bedroom in the upstairs, like we had. Our friends had a room with the bedroom part on the main floor and I think it makes the room feel much smaller as they generally didn't bother to go upstairs to use the 'living room area'. The location is pretty good, very close to Clark Quay for dining and shopping. Check In and Check out was an absoulte breeze, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed as a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: ChChCouple
Reviews.Content: Traveled with two girls, aged 6 and 8 Pros *Great location if you don't mind a little bit of walking- lots of swanky dining options and only about a 15 minute walk to Clarke Quay MRT. *Comfortable bed *Lovely pool area, with sofas etc. *Feels nice and new *Trendy room design *Awesome view (ask for a room with a river view) *Food court at Liang Court (10 minute walk on same side as hotel) great as a budget option and has a supermarket in the basement. *$23 to get there by taxi from the airport. * We found the rooms to be very quiet and unlike the review below we never heard any romantic noises lol. Cons *Rooms are rather small....person sleeping against window has to climb over the other person to get out of the bed. Sofa bed is probably a twin size, but suited our two daughters fine. Toilet and shower sort of like the size of an airplane toilet lol. However we spent very little time in our room, so the size wasn't a problem, although I could see it being an issue for some people. * The internet was a bit hit and miss until we figured it out (if you're using an apple laptop and it won't connect, the easiest way to get it to work is to connect to the wireless then open your network preferences. Then click on advanced and TCP/IP. Copy the router address and then paste it into your browser. This will bring up the log in window that for some reason would never appear unless I followed this process).

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: MindyTay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Studio M over the weekend (31st Mar - 1st April) after purchasing a weekend package from agoda, and the experience was less than enjoyable. The check-in process was fairly fuss-free and quick. The hotel parking lots are very limited, and as I needed to drive out during my stay I enquired about the other available parking options in the vicinity. The concierge staff gave me 2 options: to either park at Quayside Condominium just across the road or at Gallery hotel, and I would be given a cash reimbursement. However, I will have to obtain a receipt while exiting the carpark, park somewhere else near Studio M, and go to the concierge to present my receipt for the reimbursement. Suffice to say I was not impressed with how troublesome the entire process was. Hence my advice is to refrain from driving if you are staying in Studio M. The weekend package promised free wifi and free breakfast. We were sorely disappointed when the wifi connection DID NOT work throughout my entire stay, and this was intensely frustrating since I had hoped to get some work done. When a LAN cable was provided by the concierge counter, we were promised that the internet connection would be instant. However, upon connecting the LAN cable, it still required a log-in process which DID NOT work in the end as well. Subsequently we found a note on the desk informing us that re-cabling works were being done in the hotel till late April. Thanks (but no thanks) for the fine-print that was never mentioned when the package was purchased. The room is of a unique loft-concept (Studio Loft), well-lit with high ceilings and modern decor. The space available , however, is limited and best for 1-2 persons. Bed was very comfortable. The walls, however, are not sound-proof at all. Hence during my stay I could hear the housekeeping staff chatting merrily (and very loudly) away in the corridors at 2+ pm in the afternoon, the traffic on the road outside, and the copulation process of a very enthusiastic couple upstairs. I was not amused. The WC and the shower units are separated, small but adequate. The ledge in the shower unit where toiletries are placed, however, is stained and dirty, which was a turn-off. The sink is at a separate area where the kettle and cups are placed, with a vanity-unit providing minimal toiletries. Bring your own if you come. On the 2nd level, there is the cabana area and a small lap pool. It was 3+ pm when we explored the area, and yet the plates filled with unfinished food from the morning buffet breakfast were not cleared from the cabana tables. Not pleasant. The area around the hotel is bustling with activity at night, with restaurants and pubs a-plenty, with a chillout vibe. It is not in the heart of the city i.e. Orchard Road, but pleasant enough for exploring around the Singapore river. As we slept at an unearthly hour the night before, we were hoping to wake up later the next day. But we were rudely disturbed by incessant ringing of our doorbell at 9am, and housekeeping lady shouting "Do you want housekeeping?" repeatedly. Naturally we thought that we were merely dreaming but we were jolted to consciousness when the housekeeping lady OPENED THE DOOR HERSELF, wanting to barge in and clean up our room. I have never experienced this before during my stays in other hotels in Singapore and other countries. This was the straw that broke the camel's back. Why the rush? Is this even allowed? Pray tell. Breakfast was skipped altogether because we were too exhausted and determined NOT to let the hotel staff anger us any further. Checking out was fuss-free, and we were mighty glad for this as we wanted to leave in haste. This was not the weekend escapade I had paid and hoped for. You can definitely get much better paying a bit more for the well-established 5 star hotels. Studio M will need to work on the little details that are just as important.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Room”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: pros: unique room set up because of the loft comfortable bed lots of eating places nearby 2 bus stops away from the nearest mrt station friendly & nice reception/staff cons: no exhaust fan at the toilet literally small bathroom/toilet musty smell in the room breakfast is average

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but only if you're single or a couple”
Reviews.Author: ninja421
Reviews.Content: The hotel concept of the Studio M is very nice. It's kinda like a 2 story room on a cruise ship (it's about as "space efficient" (aka cramped). If you've ever been on the Norwegian Epic, the layout is very similar. You walk in, the shower is on your right, the toilet is on your left (each has its own small room). You walk into a small sitting area (or bed depending on which room type you get) and there is a wet bar there with a fridge. My parents and I had the room with the sofa downstairs and the bed upstairs (the premium room, as the standard room has the bed downstairs and the sofa upstairs). It's pretty tight for 3 people so it was a good thing we only used the room for sleeping. Its centralized location as great as it's only a 10 minute walk to the mall/train station, as well as numerous eateries in the area. As an added bonus, I have a friend who is stationed in the US Navy there and she happened to lived 2 blocks away so it was easy to be able to see her for breakfast before she went to work. The only reason I'd recommend against this hotel is if you're traveling with more than 2 people or are on the heavy side (the bathroom is extremely cramped and doesn't have much space to move around). Also if you have trouble going up and down stairs you'll want the standard room as it's hard to go up and down the stairs with the bed upstairs and the bathroom downstairs. I wasn't able to try the pool or gym or restaurant, but they were all by each other (also they're open air) and they all looked nice. The hotel does give free wifi access but it's kinda slow. Other than that, I'd probably stay here again as it was a nice area with a nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but incompetent staff and poor service”
Reviews.Author: vsylee
Reviews.Content: I frequent Singapore on business and have stayed in many hotels; however I must state that my 3-night stay at Studio M has been the worst. Upon arrival, I was pleased with the room design which is quite quirky and modern. The bathroom and toilets are small, but clean and worked reasonably well. However, as the stay progressed, I found that the front desk staff, housekeeping and operator were incapable of taking any instructions or messages (I am local, so this is not an issue with language or accent). A simple request like "please send up extra toilet paper" took 4 phone calls before it was executed. An order for room service almost went belly-up because they could not charge it to the room and needed me to provide the exact amount in cash. It is perplexing to get this low standard in a country like Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice design but uncomfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: lcfb
Reviews.Content: I have been numerous times to this hotel. It is a beautifully designed hotel. The swimming pool and terrace are beautiful the hotel lobby is great but much too cold to my liking and when I say cold I mean freezing because of the air-conditioning. The room are duplexes but the studios have the bed on the main floor and the loft have it on the top floor. Studio rooms are not practical. Please note that there is no bathroom as such but a separate toilet and a separate shower right next to the entrance and there is a washing cabinet in the main room which means no real privacy when traveling with a partner. To be honest I liked this hotel at first but soon found it uncritical. Free internet used to work well but I had a few problems in November. Location is great next to Robertson Walk. Smokers please note that it is forbidden to smoke on the terrace lounge bar. The Illy cafe inside the hotel has a few outside tables which are allocated to smokers and coffee is great. The bar is open 24/7. Service is getting bad except for the people handling the luggage and the furniture is starting to look worn out. Food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, and a great location too”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a colleague for its value and for being under our company's allotted 'cap' for hotel spend. This is a all 'loft-rooms' hotel, with all the basic amenities in for a business traveler at a great value. Make sure you are not a sleep-walker or afraid of heights :) since it could be a bit tricky if you are. Not recommended if you are traveling with children since rooms are small and ideally suited to singles and couples only. Breakfast was functional. Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay are walking distance (R-Quay is much closer) and the selection of restaurants and bars is wide. 7-11s within walking distance for other basic needs as well. This place is outside the CBD so plan a little ahead for taxi cabs. But unlike the CBD, this area is much more homely and quieter. Drawback: MRT station is quite a long walk. If access to MRT is important, deduct a few points when analyzing this hotel. PS: I think the hotel does not permit children under 12 anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: coethiel
Reviews.Content: Studio M is beautifully designed concept boutique hotel where ever room is a 2 story loft. This concept is spectacular in presentation a little less practical in practice, but oh well you’re just staying a couple of nights not living there forever. We had a premiere loft with the bed upstairs I don’t recommend this room for those who like to over indulge in libations, the stairs could be tricky in a drunken stupor but again it was cool. The downstairs was a seating area / work area it was tight for two not really enough seating but would be great for a single traveling on business. The pool area is really cool, we used it a couple of times (as well as smuggling out a couple of cocktails one night for a late night drink) The location is great, Sultan Mohammad road is full of bars and restaurants of all types and prices to fit just about anyone ones needs. Really close also to both Clarkes Quay and Robertson Quay for more dining, walking and drinking. The Hotel also offers a free shuttle that will take you to most of the sights around Singapore like Orchard Road or China Town. The only real downside is the rooms do smell a little musty and the bathroom and shower room are quite small, but again – it is fun place to visit you don’t have to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept,not enough space”
Reviews.Author: synequano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days last feb I was offered the room with the bed upstairs but instead i opt for the bed on the lower floor,however the stairway feels sturdy and safe,the check in process is fast and the staffs are helpful On my 1st impression,the room feels roomy because of the large window,it feels different compared to another hotels i've been to. There are some drawers to put stuff in (2 underneath the bed and 1 underneath the hanger railing) the space management is pretty smart,the separate shower and toilet is a time saver too,no more waiting to use the toilet while someone is taking a shower I like the concept,however the space is so small,the bathroom feels like mini sauna room and the toilet is soooo claustrophobic and suffocating. The corridor outside the room feels so dark,gotta put more light there My other complain is the amount of electric plug on the lower floor,simply not enough to charge 4 different gadgets,if i recall correctly there are only 2 near the phone and 2 near the water kettle (1 is already for the kettle) the other plug is near the bathroom/front door,its ridiculous that i have to go upstairs to charge the phones The free internet is a pain to use,it keeps asking me to enter username and password every few minutes and feels a bit slow There is no wardrobe in the room,just a railing with only 2 hangers (i think its not enough) The walk to clarke quay MRT is quite far,and the sign is minimal,its the homework for singapore government,basically its around 20 minutes walk along the river,until you see the shopping centre called "central" right next to swissotel merchant cour,go inside the shopping centre to take the escalator to the mrt,otherwise you have to go down the stairways (around 90 stairs..no exactly sure) the mrt is located on the other side of the river As i'm not familiar with the area,i also find it difficult to find a convenience store,the nearest 7/11 is on the other side of Moh Sultan Rd (there is a bus that goes to clarke quay mrt,the bus stop is near this 7/11) To sum up,i would recommend this hotel for those who travel light (small luggage), not too tall (the toilet might be unconfortable for taller folks),likes to walk (the mrt and bus to mrt is pretty far) and willing to try something different (mezzanine on your standard hotel room is a cool concept)

Reviews.Title: “Modern and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new and the decor is very modern. All the facilities look fantastic and the pool area is especially cool. This hotel was actually more reasonably priced than most of the hotels I looked at.The hotel rooms are split into 2 floors with a very comfy bed on the top floor. The food is of really high quality in both the restaurant and the hotel bar. The staff are very friendly and can't do enough - their English is excellent. The location of the hotel is excellent and the river side is only a couple of minutes walk in a very safe area. Along the river are various bars and restaurants which have a great atmosphere. There is also a boat cruise station by the river which you can use for a water taxi or as a tourist cruise. We took a water taxi to the Marina Bay Sands which is an amazing building and well worth the £10 fee to go to the top. The hotel is only 15-20 mins for the airport and only cost £12 in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greedans
Reviews.Content: Nice and interesting hotel. Cannot say, that i was amazed, but their two-storey rooms are somewhat uniqe. Almost like apartment. Small, but separate shower and toilet rooms. Really big window. Pricy as many singaporean hotels, really close to overpricing. Location of hotel not the best in transportation meaning: 10-15 minutes walking from MRT. But looking otherwise, you are in 15 minutes from Clarke Quay. Another 10 minutes, and you are at Esplanade/Merlion/Boat Quay area. So, I'd recomend this hotel to easy-walking types of travellers, for stay about 2-3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, queen size beds, and loud music from clubs next door”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: i tried this fairly new hotel as a slightly cheaper alternative to traditional corporate hotels that I stay in at corporate rates of SGD270-300. Still, the price of Studio M hotel is pretty hefty at a corporate rate of SGD220, which puts it a tiny SGD50-70 cheaper than big names such as Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton and Intercontinental. I was curious to go to this new hotel, so I tried it out last week. It was a bad experience. This hotel is not worth SGD220 at all. Room service is served in PLASTIC containers with PLASTIC forks and knifes. There was a bar/club outside playing loud music all night long until midnight (i came from a transatlantic flight so needed to sleep at 7pm which was IMPOSSIBLE). The hotel management was unable to stop the music of course. There was no bath tub (just a shower), no king size beds (the front desk staff looked as if i was an alien when i requested a king size bed.. "we dont have king size beds, sir, only queen size beds") In short, this hotel should reduce its rate to SGD100,and cater for backpacker tourists, but stay away from trying to be a business hotel in the SGD 200 category. Will never repeat, and have askedmy company to remove the hotel from our corporate hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with small size rooms”
Reviews.Author: hdsurya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my business trip to Singapore. The room which was provided to me was a loft type room. Overall experience the bathroom was extremely small. Decoration was average though everything is neatly placed. Breakfast is okay. The location of the hotel is a bit secluded and not strategically near any MRT station, so expect to take taxi for the easiest method to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel; Interesting Design; but Some Flaws”
Reviews.Author: HK_Observer
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here on a long weekend fun break. The hotel has a unique modern design: most (all?) rooms are two-level "lofts" with the bed area on one level and the desk, chair, shower, toilet, etc. on another level. They are quite small (well it is a modern hotel in Singapore), and can feel cramped when two people are trying to move around/get dressed, etc. simultaneously. I liked the fact that the shower and toilet were in separate rooms (like a European "water closet."), as that way two people can use them simultaneously. What I didn't like was the absence of some normal furnishings (no doubt omitted for space reasons). There is no closet -- only a rack with precisely two coathangers (two others were used for the hotel's robes). Also no towel racks. We ended up leaving a light on in the toilet all night, to avoid having to stumble down the stairs in the total dark in case of a mid-night potty run -- there was no nightlight, either. One big plus: Wifi was available throughout the hotel, and free. The staff was pleasant enough, and efficient when we asked a question. The location is pleasant.....very near the Singapore River and convenient for strolling to bars and restaurants. But it is a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest MRT station. Too long for comfort, especially in the midday heat.

Reviews.Title: “really small room”
Reviews.Author: jo y
Reviews.Content: it was a really small room with small toilet and a separate shower area. 10 mins walk from hottest night club in singapore. inconvenient from MRT. But nice room overall, but nothing too much to boast about

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated hotel, but not conveniently located near MRT”
Reviews.Author: NiENa1211
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of the design (which I like) and also I was staying away from crowded area in Singapore. Location wise it's not so convenient to reach MRT station, either walk for about 15 mins, or catch a bus from across the river. They do have free shuttle service but never seem to be able to catch them. I used taxi most of the time. Didn't try the restaurant in the hotel other than for breakfast (which was OK). But this hotel is very close to several restaurants by the river that stay open until late at night. Room is small. Didn't really like a separate shower and bathroom concept. Internet was slow. But bed was really comfy. Overall I think it's suitable for young traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the young and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Pat_anonymous
Reviews.Content: Room is very nice but rather cramped. Location inconvenient for MRT. Wonderful pool and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfy but location sucks”
Reviews.Author: Romuluz75
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a night stay for a business trip to SIN. Selected this hotel due its competitive price, the others were costly due to the on-going S'pore Airshow. The bed is located at an upper level accessible via a short flight of steps. The elderly with bad knees would hv problems heading up those stairs. Overall the cleanliness is acceptable, except for some stains on the bathroom floor, probably due to the door always being shut and humidity builds up inside. The bed was just nicely firm and comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. Pillows were of the right level of hardness for me. Lastly, the location is not acceptable to me as the only way around is via taxis which are now rather costly in S'pore. The MRT is quite a distance away at Clarke Quay and to walk there in hot humid weather if headed to a client meeting, is not a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Once will be enough”
Reviews.Author: Mandihk
Reviews.Content: Small room with a tiny toilet and a shower case size bathroom, and surprised that it was getting rust around the handle of the bathroom. Sticky stain was on the stairs and visible dust on the shelf above your pillow.... we stayed there for three nights and it was still dusty before we check out. No smiles and no greetings when we checked in. Cleaning ladies and night shift staffs seemed more friendly than those of day shift. Advise to finish your breakfast before 9:00 cause not much refill afterward. Although the design of the hotle is unique, it is far from MRT, and definitely not a good choice for family with children. Unless you are aiming at night life and pubs, I will not recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Jay8989
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on multiple occasions between 2010-2012. While the rooms are very small and the loft design may not be to the taste of some, I personally found Studio M to be a great value in Singapore. As I had frequent business right near Robertson Quay, this was an ideal location for me. Tourists I believe would have to take cabs to wherever they would need to go. Clean, quick service and reasonably priced. Bathroom was a bit cramped too, but not a big deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but not that comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positives. Hotel is well situated, within walking distance of many bars and waterfront restaurants in Robertson, Clarke and Boat Quay. The Hotel is clean, the staff were polite and everything worked. The bed was very comfortable and the rate I got through AGODA was very reasonable for Singapore prices so in my view represents value. Now.. the not so good Internet is slow and patchy, getting a taxi in the morning from 08.00 -08.30 is a pain, with long queues of 20 + people and the hotel seems to be at the end of the taxi food chain in peak periods and this was in good weather. For the rest of the day it seemed OK The dominant colour is brown, in the main passageways, dark brown walls, brown carpet and subdued lighting giving the impression you are entering a tunnel. The room has a small bathroom immediately to the left as you enter, think, economy class airline toilet minus washbashin and mirror. The Shower recess is to the right and marginally larger but the door has to be shut if you do not want water sprayed on the carpet. The decor of the room is predominantly brown and minimalist, 2 spare coathangers are supplied. There is a large netted window running the full length up to very ( 2 floors ) ceiling which in my case looked into rooms on the other side of a 20-30 mtr gap. Trying to pull the night curtains shut completely is virtually impossible due to the design. Upstairs the double bed is located in a recess with absolute minimum space. 30% of the bed is covered with a low ceiling such that you cannot stand up, only crouch. There is no other access to the inboard side of bed other than over the other part of the bed, there is no floor space to walk, there is no headroom to walk, there is no reading light or anywhere to put anything for someone sleeping in inboard position. The stairs are wooden, quite steep and painted dark brown and although adequately supplied with strong rail, nevertheless would not recommend this set up for anyone with kids, or the elderly, especially for those needing to go to the toilet very often. If one looks at the space occupied by the room in total it does not seem to be a very efficient use of the volume as so much is effectively open air and where you need some space, around the bed and in the wet areas...there is virtually none. It will and obviously does appeal to some people..... but not to me

Reviews.Title: “smoking”
Reviews.Author: bernadetteroberts10
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for two nights recently. Rooms are unique with their loft bedroom but not good in the middle of night for getting to the loo. Seriously bad cigarette burns on solid wood floor shocked me on such a new hotel. Someone had actually stubbed their cigarettes out several times on floor. The smell of smoke was quite bad and I checked the hotel details which said it had a no smoking policy as required in singapore. On querying the choking smell of smoke we were told that the first three floors were all smoking! We were on third floor. They offered to move us but as we only had another nights and our cases were half empty we said we would stay put and they put a ioniser in the room while we were out. I am suggesting to them they explain their smoking policy to customers on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: BabyHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the same hotel chain's hotel Millennium Grand Copthorne Waterfront and were not pleased with it, so was a bit scared of what to expect with Studio M as it had got a lot worse reviews than Grand Copthorne Waterfront. And luckily I was scared in vain! Studio M is a beautiful, modern hotel and good value for your money. We were so disappointed that we did not choose Studio M as our first choice and spend the entire holiday there instead of Waterfront. Studio M rooms cater to Scandinavian taste. The rooms are compact but feel bigger than their size because of the loft design. The rooms are sooo high. The look of them is clean, clear, beautiful. You feel at home in the room. We stayed in a room that had the bed upstairs, and it was lovely - the bed is sooo comfortable, the sheets lovely. We had a very good sleep. It was nice to lie in bed and watch telly. The complimentary wi-fi in every room is a big bonus, too. Many people have complained about the smallness of the toilet and bathroom. Yes I can understand that the toilet is small for people with long legs, I could fit in there just fine being 5'7, but if you are a lot taller you may not feel like staying on the toilet seat for any longer than required! :D The size of the shower is not too bad, it is the size of a bigger shower room, I felt totally fine in there, my partner said it felt slightly claustrophobic. But the decor of both the toilet and the bathroom is very nice and modern. The public areas are very pretty and modern - the pool area is great. Only bad thing is the lifts - very slow! And breakfast does not get full points as it did not serve mini pancakes (yummy!) every day and it is true that if you come around 9.30 there is not much left (e.g. fruits, only watermelon left). But the location of the hotel is good, only 14-minute walk to Orchard Road and 10-minute walk to the nearest tube station. And the beautiful river is right next to the hotel. And if you cannot be bothered to walk to either one, there is the complimentary shuttle bus. I highly recommend Studio M. Definitely one of the nicest, most modern hotels I have ever stayed in. If we ever return to Singapore, Studio M will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small but not perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: jomccallum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Studio M for a 3 night stay and were very disappointed by the hotel. The room sizes are very small to say the least. Might be ok if you are travelling on your own but for a couple it was very uncomfortable. In particular there is no en suite bathroom as such rather a separate shower cubicle and toilet each the size of a phone box. The mezzanine bed level is cramped with the bed pushed into the corner allowing access from only one side, and this was a premier loft. On a positive note the location is excellent, staff friendly and helpful and nice lappool/restaurant area. Not enough to make up for the rooms however so we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, funky rooms in a decent location...”
Reviews.Author: Sean A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Studio M for a mix of business and pleasure and overall thought this property represented good value for money in SGP (I have stayed at over 15 properties over the past 10 years in SGP). The location is great for dinners, drinks, etc... in the Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay area (you need to walk 10 minutes to Clarke). In the morning you are a S$5-8 taxi to the CBD and taxis were always around. Check in and front desk service was friendly and generally efficient. I didn't feel special, but the job got done and people were helpful when asked. The rooms are very cool (as you will see in other reviews). If a flight of stairs to your bed is not your thing, don't stay here. The toilet and shower are in small separate rooms which is a bit strange and leads to a bit jumping back and forth to get towels, etc... But a clean, cool, quiet, no-frills room. The illy coffee shop on the ground floor is a nice touch, and I grabbed an espresso with croissant each morning for a reasonable price. Cannot speak to the rest of food, but there are so many options near by that you really shouldn't be eating in house.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wow in design!”
Reviews.Author: hytrang
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with Great value, reasonable price! Booked standard loft via Agoda & have no problem at all, I even have an upgrade to premium FOC, no extra charge for kid (~4y). Check-in/out is efficient & fast. The hotel is designed in minimalism style, with everything neat & compound which makes the usable size much spacious than actual. The glass window/wall makes the room bright. My kid loves was extremely excited climbing up&down the stair & explore each corner of the room. Hotel has a pool and jacuzzi with both sunny sofas & hidden corner to relax. Adding pros are free wifi & Mac desktop with free internet near the pool. Highly recommend this hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the point”
Reviews.Author: GregRell
Reviews.Content: Studio M hotel strives to be this avant garde modern unique experience, what they gain in uniqueness of their experience they sacrifice for comfort. Once you arrive and enter the lobby you feel as if you're entering a modern art gallery reception area full with pretentious ambient mood music. The staff are friendly and attentive despite what I've read. Along the way to your room you can stop and view the hotel's amenities such as the pool and gym which are fairly typical, not-so-different from other hotels. These spaces are clean and in working order- a big plus! Once you continue to your room you'll find that it feels more like a prison cell rather than a comfortable place to stay. As you walk in, the main floor of your loft resembles as much space as a typical garden shed, maybe slightly larger. Lack of a closet is really irritating if you have more than one bag. You will find that when you open what looks like the closet door, you'll find your toilet. If you ever have to sit on it, expect your knees to hit the wall in front of you.. don't try and bend over to wipe, you'll just hit your head on the wall. The other 'closet' contains your shower. Although slightly larger it also is an epic failure of design. If you're the type of person who turns the water on to let the shower warm up before getting in it, expect to have a wet floor outside the shower door as when you open the door to get in your warm shower the jet stream ricochets off the door into your shed spaced room. There is a sink across from the 'couch' which consists of a bench with a small cushion and then there is the upper level. The twin sized bed on the 2nd floor is nice and clean. There is a TV up there too, and a whole 1 foot of space between the bed and the glass protective wall for you to awkwardly maneuver through to get to the staircase. Ensure your dreams are filled with claustrophobic nightmares during your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, interesting concept, LOUSY SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: hahn88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from our stay at Studio M Hotel, we were there for 2 nights. We loved the loft, space is good for 2 but because of how the rooms are designed, the shower and toilet are separated and they are awfully small. Location is good, there's always things to do (despite being Chinese New Year). Bed was comfortable, free WiFi. We have no problems with the room. The service is not up to standard to say the least. Room service took so long, we were away for 5 hours but our room was still not made up. When they finally came, they only left 1 new towel. We requested for another. It never came. During our checkout, the manager in charge (I believe she's the manager, because she was the only one not wearing the grey coat) Geraldine, curtly told us that to get our deposit, she needed the receipt that was given (this was not told during check-in). My partner had to go back to our room to get the receipt coz he left it there. However, the room card was already deactivated and he had to use the stairs down(our room was on the 8th floor by the way). When he went to the counter again to tell Geraldine that the card cannot be used, she just nodded and gestured to her colleague who returned our deposit. That was unprofessional to say the least. No apologies, nothing. My partner wasted his time going up to our room, only to find out the card wasn't working, went back down and got our deposit. Because of the lousy service, Studio M Hotel just deserves an Average. For the same amount we paid, we could have gone to a place with higher service standard, like Rendezvous Hotel. I am surprised that the reviews here have no issues with their service but Booking.com has plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, tight space”
Reviews.Author: wjj50200
Reviews.Content: The services and facillities are up to standard. The two-story room has tight space to move around. Breakfast and restaurants are good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DwTokidoki
Reviews.Content: I staid here for 4 night and here's my experience: Pros: 1. Upon entering, the hotel lobby smells nice. The lobby has a nice modern look. Staffs at the front desk are responsive and fast. They also speak good English. 2. Rooms are new, clean, and doesnt have a weird funky smell. The bathroom is also clean. The photos you see on their corporate website and from Trip Advisor's contributors are 100% accurate. 3. The location is near Clark Que resto bars district. 4. Hotel staffs are helpful and friendly. 5. Quality of sleep is good. Bed is comfy, clean, soft and theres not noise from the outside. 5. Free in-room wifi access Cons: 1. Breakfast is the same every day. 2. Toilet is cramped. So if you're taller than 5'7, you would fit because your knees will be hitting on the wall. You have it sit sideways 3. Shower is a bit cramped. Not advisable for large people. 4. Its a long walk to the MRT station. For me, the nearest is Chinatown station. Others: 1. Pool is great. 2. Fitness center is non air-conditioned. 3. Free usage of their complimentary computer (iMac) for internet at lobby. 4. Pricy Sorry I wasnt able to take a picture. I dont know how to angle my camera to get a good shot. The room wasnt that big to get an aerial shot.

Reviews.Title: “Really modern place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Danni_ross
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 days whilst visitng Singapore. He had booked it as a suprise for me and I loved it. The layout of the room is awesome its completly modern and I have never stayed any where like this before. The room is a loft apartment with 2 floors, the bed and flat screen upstairs and the shower and couch and other facilities downstairs. The room is actually quiet small but I dont think that hinders it in the slightest, I thought it complimented Singapore well, as like Singapore it's sleek, modern, classy and clean. We used the pool facilites and the gym both of which were really well maintained, the gym doesn't have a great amount of equipment but the basics are there. Also one night we ordered food from the room service menu which was Ok, but to be honest you are so close to the waterfront its a wasted to eat in the room. The service at the hotel was good and we found everyone really friendly. If you are looking for something really unique and different i would definatly reccomend this hotel, I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Journey09twins
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family required x2 rooms. We booked x2 mezzanine rooms. Very stylish room with the comfy bed up some stairs. Only down side is the small shower, which is basically a room that you step into.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: enelym1978
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel an average rating because it's really not bad nor good. It's just a good price for a hotel that's a bit off the center but yet easily reachable by bus and not too far from Chinatown. However, the room being in a duplex configuration, feels very small and cramped... You get a couch, shower and toilet on the lower floor, with a sink, desk. And on the upper floor you get the tv and your bed. Of course it's not a good hotel for elderly people... walking up those stairs in the middle of night for an urgent need is not what I would recommend to them. It's an interesting concept but it's just not customer friendly. The shower and the toilet are separated, good point. However, they are super tiny... Fine you don't need that much space in a toilet but the shower is bad... The door opens in the inside so you kind of have to step on a side to open the door, then reach out to grab a towel because there is no hanger inside... or even if there was one, it would be all wet from the shower you just took. The tv upstairs is not convenient... I don't want to watch tv lying on my bed... i'd rather be sitting on a couch... The staff was not unforgettable either... very distracted and not that efficient according to me.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sascha81
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for 3 Nights, booked from Agoda and the price was reasonable. Building looked nice, modern and stylist, but when i got inside, i can see that i will get not so wow service. First i saw long queue in reception which is you dont know between check in or check out line. so confusing plus not so welcoming receptionist. finally i got my turn, young guy doing the check in for me and got room no. 7... which is on 7th fl. and he showed me where the lift and i have to carry my own bag. no help offers like in the other hotels. when i got in lift putting the card and press 7th fl. nothing happening, it bounced back and i have to go up and down as got other hotel guests. after free ride on the lift i decide to back to reception and asked why my key not working. This time the young guy already gone and the girl said that my key is wrong. He gave me key for 1st fl. thats why when i press 7th not working. helloooo.... how come this things happened... so stupid. and finally i got to my room which is okay for me even its so tiny and seeiing the bathroom and toilet is super tiny. lucky im having small asian body and must squeeze in to come inside the shower and toilet. just wondering what about other guests. Basically if you gonna spend the whole day outside and just back in for sleeping, this hotel is fine. but other than that... not recommended. another good thing about this hotel is the locations. easy to walk everywhere. I cant complained so much as i spend the day outside.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere different”
Reviews.Author: Audrey G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Sept 2011 for the F1 grand prix. The room was a studio loft with the bed and bathroom downstairs and a desk/ seating area upstairs. As we used the room purely for sleeping and changing it was fine, and the location was excellent with the Grand prix circuit a short walk away along the river. We ate out although finding a breakfast location did prove challenging, however there were a number of bars/ restaurants within a short walking distance. We had no problems with check in, and we're able to leave our luggage in storage on our last day as we had a late flight. Compared to the prices for other hotels over te grand prix weekend this was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good But....”
Reviews.Author: ZZZSG
Reviews.Content: Check in was ok however front office staff needs to SMILE more. It's a pretty decent looking team, young, properly groomed but lack warmth. The housekeeping team showed more warmth than the team that's supposed to front the hotel. Stayed at the Premier Loft, nice concept, beautiful first impression, however: 1) the fridge was empty even though there was a price list of a "fully stocked" fridge 2) fridge was not working 3) counter top had dried water stains from the previous occupants 4) certain hard to clean areas (like under and between the stairs) were dusty 5) toilet and bath was super tiny Besides the above nitty gritty details, it's been a good stay. Bed was comfortable, layout was comfortable, full length window was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GandGperth
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here on our trip to Singapore and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are interestingly set out. Space is a premium in Singapore and the hotel rooms reflect this. The bed was up in a loft, very cosy and very comfortable. The bathroom and toilet are tiny and cramped. Really like being in a cruise ship room. Not a problem for most people, as you don't come on holiday to spend your day in the hotel room. Our room overlooked the pool area, which looked great, but we didn't make use of the facilities for our short stay. The lobby staff were excellent and looked after our bags on the day we checked out, while we went out shopping. They were run off their feet but still friendly, seems like a very popular hotel. As a few reviewers have noted, the hotel is not close to any of the train stations. We didn't find this a problem as taxis are one of the few cheap things in Singapore. Go check out the great shopping on Orchard Road, and Universal Studios was heaps of fun. Food is soo good in Singapore too. If you can get a good price we recommend this hotel. Singapore is notoriously expensive for accommodation so finding a bargain is crucial to your holiday budget.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, chic and trendy”
Reviews.Author: AnneHastie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very new. well decorated, nicely designed. Breakfast is very good. Service was excellent! Room is very small as well as the bathroom however, the design is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ca_fanatic04
Reviews.Content: We settled for Studio Loft room where the bedroom is on the ground level while a study area and sofa bed on the second level. Room is spacious for 2. Breakfast was mediocre, perhaps it was after 9 and we were rushed by the staff to get the leftover food as they were already cleaning up.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Loft Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon S
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night with my family of 4 in a room where a bed at the bottom and working area on top with a sofa bed and very small toilet. Overall Nice design... Got a great pool with space to hang out. Plenty of places to hangout around the hotel too! Staff here are young, very young and friendly n nice!

Reviews.Title: “Studio Loft concept = Shoebox Living. Contemporary, beautifully designed boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WeiWei2006
Reviews.Content: Our friends checked out earlier than expected, hence we stayed 3D2N as a brief getaway from our own home in SG, in order not to waste the room! Brought my 5 years old son along ... He was thrilled to see the double storey/loft area ... We rarely stay in hotels in our own country hence if I benchmark with overseas hotel stays, I must say that I'm exceptionally impressed by the cleanliness, design and compactness! The room is super tiny ... Truly a shoebox concept! The moment you stepped in there are the toilet on the left & bathroom on the right. The bathroom is so small that you can hang clothes in it else it will be wet. The table & sofa bed is on the top level (loft). The bed is next to the flight of stairs with the Plasma TV right next to it ... It's amazing how the designer can even squeeze in ll the necessities & fittings ... The only disappointment came when we rang the concierge for extra comforter/blanket for my son's sofa bed, they told us they ran out of it ... Being used to be showered with attentions by overseas hotels, I can't help but feel that it's a pity that it marred the stay a little ... My son ends up with towels & 3 bed sheets (the housekeeping team improvised) as blankets. The room size is truly good only for 1 person ... It is however near to great restaurants & night-life of SG! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and nice staff - rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: DBbonjour
Reviews.Content: Studio M was a nice enough place to stay for a family. The room layout is slightly odd but worked ok for us with 2 adults and 3 children sharing two rooms. There are no adjoining rooms for families apparently so luckily our two eldest kids were old enough to be by themselves. The bathrooms are small and airless and not very practical - ok for a short stay although already there were shoeing signs of growing mould, probably because no way of airing them properly. The room was reasonably clean although I noticed dust all over the stairs which hadn't been cleaned properly. Beds were comfortable. The stairs up to the loft sleeping area would not be practical for young children - we had a 3 year old with us and she managed ok but any younger it would be difficult. The room cleanliness was average. The good things about the hotel were that there is a nice river walk basically outside the door, the pool area was lovely with loungers and comfy chairs and tables and the staff were helpful. The hotel also provides computers and free wifi. The cafe downstairs serves a decent cup of coffee. And while the hotel is not in the midst of the shopping area we walked with the kids to Orchard Road and back and it really wasn't that far - maybe 20 mins. Also, taxis are super cheap so I think a taxi to Little India cost less then $10 and that was on a busy festival night. I'd recommend the hotel if you intend to spend time in the pool area and don't have small kids and you can get a good deal - not sure I'd want to pay the rack rate for the rooms - they're just not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding design, good service but okay room”
Reviews.Author: 99Footsteps
Reviews.Content: Studio M innovative design, good value/price and good reviews got me to choose this hotel for my short biznes/leisure 5-day trip to Singapore. The pleasant customer service and awesome beds also gets them the extra brownie points. The minus points are the small toilets & shower, distance from an MRT station (which is a 20 minutes walk to Clark Quay) and in my personal view, the overly sparse minimalist deco in the rooms, which does not give the room any comfy-mood character. Its probably good if you're just there for a comfortable sleep with the satellite TV on. I took the higher priced Executive Room and surprised to see that no sofa there :(

Reviews.Title: “Unique design, Impractical loft area.”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a unique loft room layout that while sounds like it's bigger, it's not. In an attempt to be fancy-pants, they squandered away the little open space the room had in the name of being different. The hotel is located in a business district. You'll have to take a taxi for shopping or nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Is there any "good value" in Singapore anymore?”
Reviews.Author: thadgoff Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Every other month when in Singapore I normally pay the premium to stay on Orchard Road. This time was a business trip and my first experience with this hotel in the business district. Yes it's very close to the fun at Robertson Quay but it definitely lacks the vibe of Orchard. And yes the loft rooms have an interesting design but not really very functional. The double bed in the loft was comfortable but the tight stairway up/down is a bore except for a bit of exercise. The separate toilet is the smallest I've ever seen. The shower is also separate and very small. The lighting around the sink in the downstairs living area is very poor. Actually nothing much positive to say about the room itself. The breakfast was good. Overall for S$230 I expected better value but then this IS Singapore and value is harder to find these days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Contemporary Design”
Reviews.Author: JetGypsy_11
Reviews.Content: With high cost of lodging in Singapore, Studio M feels like a good value. With its the contemporary design, great condition, great location and awesome beds, Studio M is the best value I have found here lately. Every room is set up with a loft and a 2 story floor to ceiling window which makes the rood seem very large even though it is a tiny floor space. Great bed which is probably my #1 interest. From the pillow top mattress to the comforter and pillows, the bed makes me feel like I am sleeping in my bed at home. The location on Robertson Quay is great for tourists with all of the great places to eat and drink up and down the river. For a long stay you need to take a cab out of the area to find reasonably priced food or walk a ways to some of the local fare on River Valley Road. A lot of the museums are near by and Orchard Road is a quick ride away. Great gym too. This is my go to place right now until they jack up the prices. I come every few months for work and love this place.

Reviews.Title: “inteersting but cramped and not particularly clean”
Reviews.Author: Ptibbs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are interesting, but i found them to be cramped, noisy and to be honest the bathroom was not particularly clean and the toilet was very cramped. Good idea but poorly executed. the side I was on got a lot of noise from the pool area on an evening, just what you dont need when trying to get over jet lag. Location is good for tourism, less good for business. Will not stay here again and checked out after 3 nights of my 2 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stylish option!”
Reviews.Author: Lizbuff26
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is definitely compact & I think the best layout is to have a room with the bed upstairs as otherwise the space can be a little restrictive. The bed was VERY comfy and I always had a good night's sleep (love the way you got 1 feather pillow and 1 microfibre one). The toilet is small (how long do you want to spend in there though?) but the shower was powerful and always hot! However, when you are in Singapore - who wants to stay in your hotel room when there's so much to do! The fridge isn't the most efficient and doesn't really cool drinks very well. Brilliantly situated in Robertson Quay and near to Clarke Quay MRT you can access the whole city very easily. The breakfast buffet was tasty and set in the bar/swimming pool area. Only complaint was that the swimming pool was very cold (although fine once you were swimming), however, the jacuzzi was unusable as it was the same temperature as the pool yet you're supposed to be able to sit and relax in the bubbles! It is also good value for money in Singapore where it is very difficult to find 'cheaper' accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is packaged nicely but lacks substance within”
Reviews.Author: rianeann
Reviews.Content: The room came as a bit of a shock to me, at 22 square metres, it sure is small. Due to the design, which made use of what little space it had. Stylish but the toilets are claustrophobically small, everything is packaged nicely (drinking water, hotel decor) but the service standard is non existant. Here is my letter of complaint to them: Enough said: Hi, i've booked your hotel through agoda.com and my stay (day 1) has already started to be unpleasant. Read from your information booklet that you do have a nominal charge for a bucket of ice which i've found out to be $3++. Firstly, i have never encountered any hotel with reputable standing, namely 4 stars, even 3 stars to charge for a basic necessity like this. The hotel provides a chiller, which does not chill drinks to an acceptable temperature and when i called up your front desk, which took me 3 attempts before someone even bothered to pick up the call, the response was that it is a chiller hence it just cools the drink and doesn't chill drinks like what a fridge does. If a hotel cannot provide a decent fridge/chiller that chills drinks to be ice cold, then it is really not fulfilling the purpose. It is plain ridiculous to have to pay for ice as this is not a budget hotel where rates are already kept to a minimum and additional add ons must be charged due to a whole different business model, like budget carrier for example, that i can understand and accept. So i am really wondering, why does this hotel, which is rated 4 stars and under the Millenium & Copthorne group charge for something as basic as ICE??? I've stayed in Riverview Hotel and a few other 4 stars hotels and they do not impose such rubbish. Also, the lights on the upper level, at the study area, does not work. The internet connection is intermittently being disconnected, while I understand that this is a complimentary service but shouldn't there be any standard to adhere to around here? When i checked in, i requested for a smoking room and they just replied that they currently do not have any, she failed to check with me if i'd like to be availed of 1 at a later period. There is a severe lack of anticipatory service, eagerness to serve and basic follow up service. This is my most unfortunate and unpleasant experience for hotel stays, no strive for service excellence and it seems that ensuring that your guests have a pleasant stay is of no importance whatsoever. What an utter disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a loft room, which was the perfect setup for our family. We have 2 preschool-aged children who slept on the sofa bed. We prefer to stay in the same room and it is hard to find an economical room in Singapore that is big enough to fit all of us. The service was very good, but our room was not very comfortable. It had a very musty smell and the bed was not the most comfortable. Location was ok. We were pretty close to most everything, but the MRT is not within walking distance for two little kids. We ended up taking taxis more than we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a little different, but very stylish - good service, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Gnome G
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this place may not be to everyone's liking as they are double storey but very small on each level - however, the high ceilings with full floor to ceiling windows are great - their air conditioning bills must be huge. You can't even squat a fly in the bathroom, let alone swing a cat. Decor and furnishings are great. Free Internet. Reasonably good location - you can wander down to liang court within 5-10 minutes walk which has a nice local food court ( air conditioned ) - heaps of restaurants close by in Robertson quay and good bus service into city hall only 5-10 minutes away. The pool area is really nice - rooftop set up, very large lap pool with plenty of sun or shade, depending how u feel. The hotel also seemed to have more staff than I've seen in other places in Singapore - fast and efficient service, as you would expect in th air conditioned nation....

Reviews.Title: “Funky but Fun”
Reviews.Author: Sndedit1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Studio M in Singapore 4 times in the last year. Let me start by saying that the room is paid for by the people I work for so I can't speak to value for your Singapore dollar. What you need to understand about the Singapore service industry is it is a bit relaxed compared to service you may get in the states or Australia. That being said, I find the service here pretty decent. The rooms are smallish and funky with the loft set up. The beds are very comfortable. Ask for a bed downstairs to avoid stumbling down the stairs in the middle of the night. The bathrooms are small and again a bit unusual however functional. They do make good use of limited space. I generally stay for two to four weeks at a time and am pretty picky, but I find The Studio M suits my needs perfectly. There is a good coffee shop downstairs and the buffet breakfast is decent, nothing fancy. The location is ideal for me, lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance and in a neighborhood with a lot of ex-pat families around so it feels safe. I take cabs everywhere I can't walk but I think its relatively close to public transport. Also there is a Cold Storage grocery store within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel, waste of time and money and very poor service!”
Reviews.Author: 1978josh
Reviews.Content: Terrible service Bad management Expensive Poor quality breakfast Need some lessons in how to run a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern & unusual kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: HendyLim
Reviews.Content: What we like about this hotel was their Loft style. It's clever to manipulate their limited space with style. Bathroom was unusual & not too comfortable for it's such a small space. The price was quite expensive for such a little room. and actually it's cheaper to book directly to the hotel. (We've booked the hotel by one of the online reservation and got overpriced offer, that's why we felt the hotel price was quite expensive). Breakfast was poor, almost same for every single day (We've stayed for 5 nights). Location near Clarke Quay, so it depends on your trip purpose (whether you like or you don't like it)

Reviews.Title: “A horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hoonoo
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel. To start; the taxi wouldn't pull in to the lobby probably because of the hassle factor of getting in. The drier needs to use his smart card to open the gate. We didn't realize this till the taxi dropped us off and we found the lobby. Then Alice who checked us in was less than friendly. No greeting, no smile, no help, no information about the hotel. She said only "passports". She was slow in her check in process and made one key for my husband and I. My husband asked for another key and without another word she made one and gave it to him. When we entered the room, we were surpassed by the size of the room. The tiniest room we've stayed in outside of Japan. But the problem was the lack of air-conditioning. We called the front desk and asked for maintenance and someone came right away...he cleaned the filter...still it didn't get cooler. We went to dinner and returned about 6 hours later to a hot and humid room. Again we called and maintenance came up and said he'd check the computer downstairs, (whatever that means). My husband went downstairs to find the manager and requested another room. He turned down two other rooms because of the heat...we checked in at 5 and finally got into a room that was cooled. There were 4 pillows and all of them were beyond hard. I woke with a neck ache. There is a safe in the room but it didn't work. We reported this to maintenance and he chuckled but we were without a safe. They advertise meeting rooms but, in fact, they have none. They have no business center. The restart is outdoor. The layout is dangerous, with steep wooden slippery stairs. We paid a corporate rate of $220 and it did not include breakfast! There is not one positive thing I can say about this hotel. Though it might make a good hostel.

Reviews.Title: “the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: the TA reviews show there are 47 scores for excellent down to 26 for terrible. Why such a huge range? I can offer some reasons why this is possibly so. The price on special is around $200 inclusive of tax a night with breakfast and free wifi which, for Singapore, is very good. The location by the Singapore river for nightlife and restaurants is great. The mezzanine level loft is 'trendy' and different. Its quite new, staff are friendly, and the food I had ranged from excellent to good. The bed is very comfortable and pillows and sheets just great So why do I mark it only average? Well the location is now where near an MRT and getting taxis is hell unless you leave at 0730. The room toilet and shower (as everyone says) is a box with no ventilation and smell. The 'journey' up and down the stairs to the bathroom in the night is akin to scaling Everest - one slip and hospital awaits (no one with less than cat like agilty should consider this place)...... The TV is upstairs so you have to leave the longe downstairs and lie on the bed to watch TV. The wifi slows down rapidly, the room service was so bad on one day it took 1hr 20mins and was given free. The next day they said 45 min because they said they were understaffed and then it cam in 10 minutes! Part of the room service menu is served in disposable plastic box and disposable cutlery (on the pretext of "hygiene and cleaner suppoundings"!!) . The staff are friendly but the management of them is the big issue plus many can hardly speak english and this applies to front line staff. So there are great things and there are terrible things. I can see that if things go wrong for you it will go very wrong, if you love the trendiness and nothing happens to your stay you may think its excellent. For the price I thinks it average, I experienced enough of the problems to say I will not be back but its not the worst hotel I have stayed in (unless of course you fall off the desk while walking up the stairs!) Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good use of space!”
Reviews.Author: NPUk
Reviews.Content: Okay, the design of the rooms might not suit everyone but I loved it and thought it was a very clever use of space. I stayed in the premier loft type room with the bed in the loft area, which was extremely comfortable. Room temperature was perfect, air con was quiet and didn't need to be touched. Not loads of room in the lower part of the room but it works; 3 of our friends somehow managed to share one room! Free wifi works well, the pool is long and great for 'proper' swimming, also a small gym but didn't use this. Bar is good with a great selection of beers from around the world. Location is great for both for the overpriced bars and restaurants in the quays, and the fantastically cheap restaurants and hawker centres of Chinatown. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “trendy but 2 star”
Reviews.Author: giacomo_cattaneo
Reviews.Content: the web site is fantastic !( for them) but when i wanted ti cancel it went in to a loop and stuck : i sent an email and the said to first book antoher date and then they would cancel ( i was before cancelling deadline . Th room is student loft only more dangeous . the stairs to the bed are steep and slippery . stuffy room it reminds of 2 star england ( but maybe this is intended to impress the asians ) to make it livablke they stick the air condition far too high the fridge was empty .i gave two shirts and they came back the following day ....unwashed . i asked advice to deliver a parcel in town the concierge said they do not offer this kind of service and started giggling witha a friend good location

Reviews.Title: “Generation X/Y Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrazzaMH
Reviews.Content: Quite a funky hotel half-way in between Orchard Road & Chinatown. I liked my loft room and loved the pillowy soft bed but I wouldn't recommend this place if you suffer vertigo (the stairs are steep) or claustrophobia (the toilet & shower are of broom closet dimensions). The hotel has a leafy, open-air dining and bar area with comfy chairs, a lap pool & jacuzzi where the reasonably good buffet breakfast is served.

Reviews.Title: “Super-funky change from the norm”
Reviews.Author: feckineedjut
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great a real change from the usual hotel. The loft style is awesome and the hotel itself is great. Pros: location is superb, loft style rooms are very cool and a nice change from traditional hotel, food was so good, nice pool, close to Robertson quay and Clarke quay. Cons: getting a taxi can be a pain, rate is high, breakfast was extra from Agoda rate, rooms style is different for premier/premium (one has bed downstairs, other has the loft arrangement...you want the upstairs bed, or the room feels way too small)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay! Thank you Studio M”
Reviews.Author: alec_ice
Reviews.Content: Just back from Singapore for a birthday weekend and luckily we discovered this fantastic hotel with a unique room, friendly and professional staff and what a great location being right in the middle of everything at Robertson Quay. I had a reservation here but wanted to be sure it was a nice room as we had a bad experience at another property across town so we popped in for an inspection and Natalie from the front office showed us around. She was so great and really sold the property. The room is loft style which is very cool compared to the standard room type available in Singapore can be quite small so this gives you the feeling of extra space. We enjoyed the river and city skyline view so much and the many restaurants and shopping all within walking distance. Would highly recommend a night walk along the Singapore river going either direction from the hotel. the popular Clarke Quay is a short walk and Chinatown is also near by. One extra bonus is they have Illy coffee :)
