Reviews.Title: “Interesting room, shame about the smell”
Reviews.Author: Traveller--_--UK11
Reviews.Content: Split level room with lots of interesting design features. Only for the agile though, have a look at the photos before booking as it won't suit everyone. Very comfortable bed though not much headroom on one side and against the wall. Loo in a cupboard is a bit cramped but the rest of the room feels spacious for a city hotel. Huge full wall window. Unfortunately the room, despite looking clean, smelled very bad which was still noticeable on waking. The rest of the hotel areas were fine. Breakfast is served in the open air, had a good selection and was tasty. Very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “stylish studio loft”
Reviews.Author: mutkit
Reviews.Content: trendy hip hotel.studio loft with another work environment above making aprivste environment.shower separated from toilet howevrr no space to hang our changing garment.tjough the loft's sofa bed too small for man ,only suit.for children or small size persons.basin outside toilet wster spilt easily.clean room,slippers are on request.fine for sort stay

Reviews.Title: “Better for a single business traveller ...and don't confuse it with Hotel M”
Reviews.Author: David O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient, clean and the staff are helpful. Warning: make sure you know that you are staying at STUDIO M Hotel and not the M Hotel, which is in a different part of Singapore - we went to the wrong one first - the receptionist there told us that this happens a lot. Our booking included breakfast which was reasonable quality. The free WiFi works well, without any hitches. Like other travelers have commented, the loft rooms are unusual - we had one with the bed downstairs. For a couple, it was fairly squeezy - the shower and toilet are more like two separate small cupboards. For a single business traveler, it would be fine but less suited to couples and definitely not for small children. The light switches operate like some kind of deranged mind game as each light seems to be operated by at least two switches and each switch seems to operate at least two lights.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting but loses its appeal very fast”
Reviews.Author: Finendandy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the free wifi - which was perfect through the whole stay. The front desk gave me the password and it worked without a hitch my whole stay. The room itself however, I found hard to get used to. It was tiny and being a loft, the bed was up a flight of narrow stairs into a cubbyhole type area with a low ceiling. A real pain in the night when I had to go to the (little tiny) bathroom. I've always found it hard to get used to bathrooms with the commode inside and the sink outside - this is one of those places. I had a corner room overlooking the bar (disco?) so the booming bass beats could be heard till late even though I was on a high floor. If you stay here, ask for a room away from the end of the corridor. Overall, the loft was an interesting concept but the small room and inconvenience of climbing up and down the stairs to go to bed is something I'd do only once for the experience. Not a place I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough Hotel, Tiny rooms and not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Orren K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. Myself, my wife and our 11yr old son. The rooms are nice but very very small. This Hotel is not at all suited to a family. Staff were very nice but service was very slow in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “OK in asian standard”
Reviews.Author: phillip_wei
Reviews.Content: Good: good value, close to restaurants, fast check-in and check-out. Bad: toilet paper misplaced in the wardrobe and none in the toilet; mini-bar was empty; had to call guest service 5 times to get someone to answer the phone. 15mins walk to MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Small and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TejasJ
Reviews.Content: The Loft type rooms are small but seemed ideal for an individual/single person visiting on a business or personal trip. It did not seem to be a family hotel from the word go. Basic amenities like bathroom footwear, a small basic cupboard to store clothes were missing. The safe lock had problems twice which had to be changed in the end. The cleaner help never cleaned the loft area(upper deck). The cleaning was restricted only to the lower deck of the room. The Wi-Fi connectivity never worked. If you are carrying more than 1 reasonably big bag, you will have to climb the stairs and park the bag on the upper deck. There is no space to keep bags on the lower decks. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The air-conditioning in the room was good. The TV was working fine however would have loved to have some more international channels.

Reviews.Title: “Very European - small, decent - not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: larevue
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small - not a big fan of two floor room, as bed was upstairs and constrained. Rooms are very European in size = small. Decent location - but quite honestly overpriced for what they offer - shifted the next three days to Conrad Singapore and admittedly - comparing a lexus to a high end volkswagen....but the lexus is worth the extra 40-80 USD per night. Breakfast was very positive - get this in your rate - it was quite tasty and well coordinated.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff, great location, creative design.”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Singapore regualarly for over five years, I was very relaxed leaving Australia. Arriving late on sunday night, I had realised that while I was in the Qantas Lounge, I had left the keys to the lock on my suitcase at home. I rang ahead to the hotel and didn't know how I would fare as I had never stayed at this hotel before. Upon arrival at approximately 11:30pm, they raised my issue with me and dispatched an extremely helpful technician with his tools turned out in overalls really looking the part. He had an enourmous set of bolt cutters and was overjoyed when he swiftly removed the padlock and I could access my suitcase. I was sorry that I did not have any Singaporean currency (left it at home as well!) I would have gladly tipped him. I was impressed with the hotels design and construction, it is only a couple of years old and well maintained, I thought it had a very interesting design and execution. The loft rooms a bit of fun, the bed was very comfortable and had a massive desk. The WC and shower are in seperate little rooms, cupboards almost. I had experienced similar at Wanderlust in Little India Singapore. The main criticism I would have is that the lower floor (entry level) is carpeted, unlike Wanderlust which was tiled, so if water leaks out of the shower are, or if you step out wet, you wet the carpet. So a small thing really, I felt the ammenities were great. Breakfast was outdoor, undercover on the large deck with the pool and ponds, with great little lounge areas for groups, I thought it was all very funky and was much more interesting than staying at one of the older hotels in the area. The price represented excellent value in my mind. The location at Robinson Quay is excellent for the frequent visitor who enjoys the variety and quality of dining options of the river district. I only stayed briefly for work, and look forward to staying longer at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Statisfactory Mmmmm”
Reviews.Author: the_thorne
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is ok, relatively central. From Changi airport you can take the subway to City Hall or Clarke Quay and get a taxi from there to the Studio M. It's a taxi ride or subway trip to most places across the city. Check-in and Check-out were pretty seemless being that it was not busy. Having arrived at about 9am we were glad that a room was made available to us considering we were checking in early. We stayed in a premium loft for 4 nights and liked the style of the room on the split level although it was a little strange walking across the desk in order to open and close the curtain. Similar to other guests, our room smelt damp. We only noticed it when we came back from a day out. It was not unbearable. I'd probably recommend this hotel because of it's location and price in comparison to others.

Reviews.Title: “Ranked 85th in Singapore, for a reason...”
Reviews.Author: Brendan D
Reviews.Content: Studio M is a smaller, cheaper version of M Hotel with a unique twist of having trendy loft style rooms. It is located near the banks of the Singapore river next to Robertson Quay. The location is pretty central and there are lots of restaurants nearby which cater to the tourist and expat crowd. My partner and I picked this hotel because the rooms looked cool and modern on the website and because it was reasonably located and priced at $$250 per night. The hotel has a lot of problems however: The rooms are poorly built and maintained. Modern and trendy yes but also cheap, poorly maintained and just not practical for a hotel room. Our room smelt of mould and damp because the shower is a very small enclosed room with poor ventilation. Every time we returned to our room is had a bad smell because of this. You can clearly see lots of mould growing on the walls of the shower, but they make no attempt to clean this. There is no private area to get dressed as there is no normal type bathroom in this hotel. The shower and toilet are two tiny cubicle like rooms either side of the entry door. Even the wash basin is located in the living area opposite the desk, chair, etc. So when getting dressed you must do so in the living area, and you may have to do so in full view of your neighbors, since the hotel is built in a "H" type floor plan. The internet is painfully slow, there is one wireless router for all guests to log onto. I called reception and asked them if I could do anything to get a faster connection. The staff mentioned that they knew it was slow and said it was because everybody was online.... so they offered to bring an ethernet cable to the room which gave no improvement to connection speed at all. You need to be nimble to get to bed. If you are older, have some mobility problems or an injury of any type that prevents you from climbing up small winding tight stairs, avoid this hotel. The bed is located atop these stairs in a mezzanine type landing, the bed is queen size, lots of headroom on one side but one half of the bed was under a pillar in our room, meaning one person has about max 1 meter headroom. TV is located updaters in the sleeping area so you must be in bed to watch it. You are not allowed to watch TV in the living area ;-) must go to bed first! If you are in Singapore on business and it's raining and you have to be at work on time in the morning, get downstairs 1 hour earlier than you normally would. This morning lots of people were waiting over 1 hour for a taxi, some people had a sense of humor failure, there was plenty of shouting going on at the hotel staff for their inability of organize taxi's. Sure it's harder to get a taxi when it's raining but all good hotels have a decent relationship with the taxi booking office and are able to get cabs in a reasonable time, thankfully I didn't have an appointment this morning... Later in the morning when I came back from a run, the hotel staff were telling a taxi who was waiting for a fare outside to leave! It was still raining, no wonder they are back off the queue.. There are very limited food and beverage options at this hotel. A coffee shop with a limited menu, a average restaurant that is open for dinner, no bar or entertainment available. There is a 25m lap pool. Lap pool means it is very narrow. There is a small gym with 5-6 items. Service is OK and staff are friendly enough although they are poorly trained. They make plenty of mistakes with orders and it's all down to lack of training and management. It seems to me that there are 3 major issues with this hotel: 1. Poor design layout of the rooms. 2. Lack of decent facilities. 3. Poor management of the hotel and staff. At the time of writing this review, the hotel ranked 85th in Singapore, which I guess is about right. I didn't have a terrible experience, no major issues, but I won't be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes for one week”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy66
Reviews.Content: Great place for short business stays. I stayed in a premium loft. This has the bed on a mezzanine level. The disadvantage is you can only watch TV in bed and then you leave it on with the remote controler upstairs so have to climb to switch off. Everything is small and compact so a week is maximum for single occupancy only. Toilet, shower, both separate and very small. I didn't like the basin being in the main room and looking like a kitchenette! Also you only get a rail for your clothes, no wardrobe. Otherwise clean modern and pleasant. Breakfast is outside so a bit warm and humid but nice restaurant near nice pool. The cooked breakfast itself was average to poor and inconsistantly so. Nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: eddietanexplorer
Reviews.Content: Im surprised to check in into this hotel last week. Extremely clean and lavish rooms. Nice service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Funtional, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: RICHOSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my wife. Yes the rooms are kind of pokey, but they are totally functional for a couple wanting a hotel close to the vibrant night life along the Singapore river. Located just behind Robertson Quay its also an easy walk to Fort Canning park. 2 story mezzanine style rooms with double height windows are pretty cool, you'll find the toilet and shower are pretty small separate little cubicles, but really how long do you spend in those spots anyway. The shower did have a little mould behind the door and but apart from that the room was nice and clean. The bed was super comfy and the WiFi worked all the time with no problem, not sure of the cost as it was included in the room rate. Breakfast (also included in our room rate) was excellent with a good selection. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. For business, it's not the most convenient to the MRT, but the location close to a great choice of night life and restaurants makes up for the short walk to a bus or having to hail a cab to get to the office. Definitely recommend staying in this hotel if your Ok with something a little quirky and pay mid range pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Effala
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. Everything is expensive in Singapore but at least this place is worth the price. Nice pool area, great room lay out and free WIFI. And check out a wonderful restaurant just a few feet away: Epicurious.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel worth a second visit!”
Reviews.Author: JoyCena
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about booking here after reading some reviews, but we are so glad that we selected this hotel. We stayed for 6 nights in this We had one premium loft room and two standard loft rooms for our teenagers and other adult members of the family. The rooms would stretch to accommodate 3 people as the storage was minimal. The pool and bar area is superb allowing large groups to congregate in cosy private areas. An easy 15 minute stroll along the waterfront to Clark Quay and instant access to cafe's, bars and restaurants right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Just average, would expect better service from a Millenium Group hotel”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel for 2 nights recently in Sept. On arrival, I had a bell boy help me with my luggage from the taxi. During checkin, I was told that my room was not ready yet (1pm). Check in time was officially 2pm. I asked the gentleman working at the front desk why could they not get a room ready when there are 160 standard lofts and it is not a peak period like the F1 weekend? He looked lost and his colleague, a lady came by and accomodated me. A room was available for me immediately. Thank You for that. The check-in area was small and decorated in a 'hip and arty' way. It can get really crowded at times. The bell boy seemed busy. I had to lug my luggages up the room myself. The service was touch and go. I was left disappointed. The problem is that most of the staffs were from China and could not really communicate well in English. When I opened my room dorr, I was overwhelmed with a musty smell. This is supposed to be a new hotel...where did the smell come from? From the shower room. As some reviewers have mentioned, the bathroom is a very very very small cubicle located just next to your room door with no ventilation. No ventilation = smell! It felt like a bomb shelter in there....no air. I would not say its the smallest bathroom I've seen....I've seen worst..but I would consider it small for a Millenium brand hotel in a city like Singapore. Bed was queen, and upstairs. Would not recommend for families with kids. Bed area was cramp....imagine sleeping on the upper deck of a double decker bed - that's it. Cool concept but it seems like they are rather stingy on the space when building this hotel. Bathroom Amenity includes: Lotion, Shampoo, Bath lotion, shower cap, cotton pads/buds, toothbrushes. Bedroom slipers available on request. All in all, I think its a cool concept but I would not return because its very small. It feels like they were trying to crap everything together. Location wise, not fantastic. 10-15mins walk to MRT Hotel is near quay area. Good for dining and nightlife. Far from shopping district...relatively near to CBD (by taxi) I used the gym.....it was well equiped with weights and cardio equipments. No air-con in gym. Open area concept

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ParvezShah
Reviews.Content: My kid loved the bed:))) as he just fell asleep whenever we were back in our room. And we were able to find nice South Indian food within a few metres of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good idea but not really practical. Also noisy and the air con is in your face”
Reviews.Author: VitaminM
Reviews.Content: So looking at the photos of the Studio M hotel, I was enticed to give the place a try - I figured the concept of a loft in an alleged trendy area would unduly compliment my transition to a full fledged metrosexual. I mean I had the tight pants and a pair of trendy RayBan wayfarers going for me. But honestly, the Studio M hotel leaves much to be desired. About the Studio M hotel: - The shower area is like an enclosed box and I couldn't detect ventilation. If you're tall, then you will feel cramped. Without ventilation,it's humid, so the usual suspects of soap scum and browish/greenish mold is highly visible. So do the uncool thing and bring some shower flip flops. - The pool area houses a bar/"cool" hangout place, complete with nightly BLASTING music. Even after repeated phone calls to the front desk, the noise issues will not be solved, the bass beat noise will make it hard for you to sleep. - Try calling front desk ( there's no direct housekeeping line) for service, and your phone will get automatically cut off at times. I suspect that if too many people call and no one answers, the system just cuts you off to discourage you from calling. - The Airconditioning opening is very close to the bed, so with the aircon on ( you have no choice, it's Singapore, you don't turn the ac off when it's 30 degrees outside ) , your face and head will be greeted with cool breezes all night. So your face will be perpetually cold. I guess Eskimos would feel right at home. - Location - it's a good location with nice restuarants and bars close by if that's your gig. Beware though, if you have early morning meetings at 9AM, then you may encounter long lines in the lobby for taxis, as they are hard to come by. Over the years, it's been harder and harder to get or call for taxis because the pSingapore is booming with tourists and business people. Second of all, the location of the hotel doesn't help when it comes taxis. Finally - with the premier loft, the bed is on the 'second' floor of the room. So if you need to go the bathroom in the middle of the night, you will have to navigate down a set of narrow stairs. Make sure you avoid getting drunk or partying too hard before going to bed. Only a hip high glass divider separates you and a skull cracking 14 foot fall. So I'd say with the many choices in Singaore, you can definitely skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and chilled out - but lofts are not for me”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: While trying this hotel a few times, I have realised that while it looks bright, airy and trendy, the loft stairs to the bed is not for me, albeit that I am still quite capable of going up and down stairs, it is just a headache in the middle of the night. That said, it is in a great location for bars and restaurants and the staff are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok stay - neither pleasant nor bad.”
Reviews.Author: Pyng
Reviews.Content: My sister and i choose to stay here because it was recommended by a friend since we wanted a hotel nearby Clarke Quay. We had booked in another hotel but now needed an extra night stay. Since it was last minute planning, i didn't have to time to check with Tripadvisor like i always do. From the hotel's glossy website, we thought it looked alright and so we made the booking. For the price we paid, i wished now that i would have read the reviews beforehand. I don't want to sound like a broken record but the hotel is as what they say. The good is that it is an interesting modern concept which is great for travellers in search of something different. Besides that location was good as it was a nice leisurely walking distance to Clarke Quay/Roberston Quay. Breakfast was just alright and al fresco. And yes, rooms are unusual and it is indeed a loft with split level floors. Although it may seem spacious at first because of huge windows giving it an airy feeling, the design and layout of the room was just awfully awkward after a while. The upstairs of the loft had a sofa and a writing desk which was just redundant. Hate the tiny shower room (bad if your are claustrophobic) while their sink was outside in the room underneath the stairs. Service was substandard and as mentioned, be prepared to wait long to be checked-in. Noticed that there were many other travellers waiting around too and there was a whole pile of luggage bags laying in the corner of the lobby as the hotel has no place to store them. It was fortunate that we were staying only for one night and was glad to move to our original hotel booking which was for Marriott Hotel at Orchard Road. Well to say the least, the stay was neither pleasant or was horrible but i wouldn't pay again to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugEnnis
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, right on the river with excellent restaurants and nightlife very close by. The pool is adequate and breakfast excellent. The only downside is that the windows in the bedroom do not open and there was a smell of body odour as a result in our room. 9th floor is very quiet and has great views

Reviews.Title: “dreadful. stay ANYWHERE but here....”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDude2011
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on Tripadvisor before, but our recent experience has made me so angry that I simply must do so today. Studio M is very poor.. please do yourself a favour and go ANYWHERE else in Singapiore. This is for numerous reasons. Our initial impression was bad because even though we arrived at 2pm we had to wait 2hrs+ to check into the room, which was annoying, and when we did check in i was shocked at how poky and small the rooms are - like a cheap student residence. You practically cannot turn around in the shower room or loo as they are so small (am I am only 1.7m and 70kgs so not a big person. For the price this is horrific value for money. The whole floor of the hotel smelled of glue and paint due to some redecorating work they were doing and so we could hardly sleep due to the fumes and woke up with headaches. On the saturday night we were there the people renting the room next door (about 5 young teenagers) were playing music until 3am and would not be quiet even though i asked reception. in the end I had to confront them myself since the reception desk could not be bothered to do so. On the other nights we stayed the road outside was also noisy.... The cleaning and room staff were okay but the front desk were rude and generally unresponsive to complaints (I think they'd heard it all before). Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Move on...”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I usually suffer from verbal diarrhea when it comes to reviews and opinions of stays, restaurants and everything in between but was so underwhelmed with this property that I get bored trying to recall the good and the bad. There was much more of the latter, unfortunately, and most of it was due to the care-free (read: couldn't care less) staff who all need to put themselves in the guest's shoes for an hour to understand how detrimental they are to their own brand. Travelers: move on!

Reviews.Title: “Super dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Climsp
Reviews.Content: 2 hr plus after 2pm check in time!! Room is still not ready!! Have to show temper at counter to get the room!! If never ask n throw temper, think have to wait longer!!! Really spoilt mood!!

Reviews.Title: “interesting ... different ...”
Reviews.Author: nick_ng
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely unlike most hotels. Hence I find it interesting. Reviewers before me have already compared this hotel's features to other 'normal' hotels. Their comments are fair statements. You need to be prepared ahead of time before checking-in (to avoid a rude shock) for the 'differences'. If you want standard features, don't come here. If you don't mind something different & are game for a change, this place is right for you (as it was for me). The check-in/check-out counter is an island. Customers can be attended to from any direction. This was the first interesting feature for me. It's unlike standard hotel counters. The reception area/ lobby is compact. The corridors are narrow, narrow but for me, this isn't a big deal for me. By now, you get the idea that things are going to be 'smaller'. I like the room design. The room they upgraded me to has a loft concept - bed & TV upstairs, everything else downstairs. What other reviewers wrote about the toilet & shower are accurate & sadly, true. #1 they are separate so you have to walk across from one to the other (unlike in normal hotels, both are in the same space) #2 the shower cubicle is 3 feet by 4 feet by 6+ feet (see attached photo) #3 the toilet is small enough that it's a challenge to bend over completely to pull up your pants. Here, I don't spend much time in these 2 places, so they don't bother me. The restaurant on level 2 where breakfast's served is all open-air (by covered overhead) so it's a nice change from the air-conditioned places. This is in Robertson Quay so there are lots of restaurants all around & it's a buzzing place at night.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and resembles a backpackers hotel, not for couples or families!”
Reviews.Author: akica
Reviews.Content: As you enter the hotel, the service desk is small and the waiting area pretty much non existent. You take a lift to your floor, we were on the top floor 9. You open the door to your room, immediately on your left is the toilet door, on your right it is the shower door. The toilet is very cramped and no room to move in, even smaller than shopping centre toilet cubicles! The shower is extremely small, with the normal white room door which makes you feel horrible while showering, instead of relaxed. A couple of steps from the entrance door on the left (after the toilet) is a small bench space which is located under the staircase, that small bench space has a sink which is the only sink in the room, so no sink in toilet , no separate bathroom. On the right side of the sink which is under the staircase is a small space to put a suitcase on and a couple of hangers for towels. From the from entrace door, it is abour 3 steps to the bed which is placed in such an awkward position, right next to the window which also has a small ledge near the bed where the tv is positioned. So if you are on the left side of the bed, you have to go over the person who is on the right side or leap over the staircase. The little attic like space as you go up the stairs is a waste of space. With a small seat and a ledge for a lap top is a waste. It was not used at all. The outdoor area and pool is good. The entire hotel feels unwelcoming, cold and not relaxing at all. It would suit those travelling on their own, but then again it is not close to the MRT (train or bus) and taxi is the option, which is not always convenient. I would never stay here again, especially as a couple, it is not worth the money at all. I am so sorry that i stayed here, as i couldn't relax in the room at all, and it was a pain to keep catching a taxi to go into town. Would love to hear how your stay there was!

Reviews.Title: “Trying to create a cutting edge design, but sacrificed any level of comfort!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: Good points: The hotel has a great location close to Robertson Quay; the bed and bedding were very comfortable: it has a really nice pool area; I received my early morning wakeup call as I had requested; and the taxi to the airport was waiting for me at the exact time I had asked for. Bad points: The design of this hotel , in it's attempt to be cutting edge, has sacrificed all comfort to the point of being ridiculous. My room had a double bed; shower room; separate toilet; and sink on the first level. The stairs to the second level or mezzanine are so steep I think they are dangerous. If you were to slip on the last step where the stairs make a 90 degree turn almost against the huge window, you'd be lucky not to go hurtling to the street below followed by a trail of broken glass. The main feature of the rooms is the massive window, but just to close the curtains to the hundreds of office and apartment windows looking straight in to your room, you have to crawl along the boxed window ledge, which is also doubles as the side of the bed, with nothing to hold on to, and only the glass to lean against! Hence closing the curtains presents the same risk! The shower is a tiny room on it's own right next to the entrance to the room. The toilet is a separate room opposite the shower and on the other side of the entrance. The toilet is so small that a tall person's knees would easily jam against the wall which is about 6 inches from your face when in a seated position! It is claustrophobic in the extreme! The basin doubles as the sink and is located outside of either the shower or toilet and can be found at the foot of the bed. Because of the layout, there is no privacy at all in the room. There is not enough room to dry or dress in the shower room, so you must put the bathmat on the carpeted floor in front of the main entrance and step outside to dry and dress - which is where the necessity to close the curtains to the hundreds of windows looking directly into the room comes into play! Don't book this hotel if travelling with friends in front of whom you'd rather not appear naked, or if you have a fear of heights or small spaces!

Reviews.Title: “no space in a cockroaches dwelled room”
Reviews.Author: mojun
Reviews.Content: small room with no space to move freely or cabinets where to put your clothes except 2 small drawers under the bed. cannot keep airconditioner on without getting a cold. small cockroaches come out from under the sink that is in the bedroom within 2 feet of the bed crawled on my bathroom stuff. you can see them occasionally on the bed connected night table. crew forgot to put toilet paper. breakfast ok but when it rains or there is some wind you will experience leaves in your food and water pours on the buffet from a leaking roof. toilet is noisy from other floors usage. shower is big enough but water pressure is average

Reviews.Title: “Debatable, but good enough for me.”
Reviews.Author: zaqxswcde
Reviews.Content: The reviews about this hotel can be pretty debatable. If you are trendy and like cutting edge modern style, this is it. But if you are on the conservative side, stay away. The rooms have double stories so the floor area is smaller (actually very small) compared to average hotel rooms. The first floor has a bed, toilet, shower and a wash basin, and the second floor has a desk and a sofabed. Please take note that there is NO BATHTUB (at least in the room that I stayed) and the shower booth is incredibly SMALL. Complementary breakfast is pretty good and the swimming pool is great! Not to mention about the location, it's 10 minutes walk to downtown along the Singapore River. Also it is at the end of Mohammad Sultan Rd, which is famous for it's clubs and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Transferred me to another hotel on Day 1!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkfacedbunny
Reviews.Content: I would give them 4.5 stars, but my first day ruined it.. so 3.5 stars! I stayed here from July 7 - 20. Arrived at 4am in the morning or so, and they said they were fully booked. Transferred me to a sister hotel (Orchard Hotel) for 1 night and agreed to pay for my cab both ways, so I went without complaint. I forgot to ask for the cab receipt on the way back, so no cab refund was given. When I checked out at 12pm and came back to Studio M the next day, Studio M told me that their rooms were not ready and I had to wait another 3 hours. So here I am, tired as hell since I got in at 4am, slept at 6am and woke up at 11am to check out, and I can't get into my room. I asked, "what else is there that you could do for me, since I've already booked my 13 day stay and I spend day 1 at some other hotel?". The receptionist looked a little embarrassed, called her manager and fixed it. Voila, I got a corner loft and it's miraculously ready all of a sudden. Great. Got in my hotel, I really liked it. It was almost brand new, very clean, and the cleaning service was very prompt every day. The pool was very enjoyable as well. The rest of my stay went without a hitch, and I enjoyed my time at Studio M. If not for the switch of hotels on day 1, I would have given it 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Clark Quay Area”
Reviews.Author: mpowers14
Reviews.Content: A very modern, boutique type hotel in a quiet, interesting section of Singapore. Very small 2 story rooms. Our room type had a sitting area on the bottom, and a loft with a queen size bed. The bed was really comfortable with great pillows. These rooms are small but functional. They are great for a solo traveler or a couple. I'm not sure a family, even with one small child, would be happy here. I'm also not sure a rather large or heavy person would be happy with the small toilet area, and going up and down narrow open stairs...otherwise, no matter what your size, just try not to lean against the narrow plastic half-wall that separates you from the floor below your bed on the loft! I mean it looks sturdy, but it didn't inspire alot of confidence in me! This hotel has some great features though, like the beautiful, large pool and lounge area on the 2nd floor that is quiet and cool. It has decks that meander around pools of water, on which large white globes float. Large overstuffed, upholstered sofas and chairs are settled in little sitting areas where you can have a nice private spot to relax and have a drink. The pool is long and narrow but perfect for swimming laps. There's a smaller pool on the side for relaxing. There are rows of lounge chairs facing the pool. The fitness room next door is well-equipped and supplies thick towels. The small restaurant on the first floor has good food, with indoor or outdoor seating along the sidewalk. There's also an extensive room service menu. Free wifi is available anywhere in the hotel, and outside of the restaurant is a mac computer for your use. There are also two mac computers outside of the lounge area on the 2nd floor. The hotel offers a free shuttle service that runs from 10am to 8pm around other Millenium hotels in Singapore, and also goes to Orchard Rd., and other prime stops. Taxis are usually waiting at the front door, and if not, the front desk will call one for you. If you want a hotel room to be your home away from home, this is not it. If you want a good base from which to explore Singapore, then this is a fine choice. Unfortunately, it's not close to an MRT station, but is accesible to a bus stand 2 blocks away. Take a taxi -- its so much easier in the long run, and most fares in the city will not be more than $4 or $5 at the very most. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close-by within a short walking distance. And just across the street is the Singapore River and very colorful Alkaff Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel enough!”
Reviews.Author: bal789
Reviews.Content: Surprised to see such appauling reviews. Loved the loft concept of the rooms and the decor across the hotel. Lost a bag there and the staff were very efficient in helping me get it back. Convenient walk to Clarke Quay bars and restaurants. The only downside I experienced in this hotel was the size of the toilet. Clearly not enough thought went into the room layout. The shower also felt slightly claustrophobic being in a different room opposite the toilet with low lighting. Aside of that, it was a wonderful and convenient stay.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Compact and Great Location for food”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolFans
Reviews.Content: Actually we were quite pessimistic to select this hotel for our family summer vacation in June since some of the reviews are not very favorable about this hotel. However when we arrived there we couldn't be more pleasantly surprised. Starting from the lobby, it is a simple, minimalistic, yet tastefully decorated place. One of the smallest lobby and reception area that I have encountered, yet it is not a problem. The service was quite fast even though we had a couple of people queueing in front of us when we checked in. The room itself was great. True, it is small, but not surprising since this is SIngapore, not Jakarta where hotel rooms tend to be huge. It needs a getting used to because of the loft design and unique storage area (there is no traditional wardrobe, mind you. All you have are a number of large sized drawers). We love the loft design, our daughter especially since that means she could get her own bed upstairs. Showering, can be quite a painful experience due to the very small design, however it is well designed, the water pressure was great. The only complaint is the lack of exhaust fan in the toilet area (yes, this hotel has a separate area for showering and toilet). If you have to go and do 'stuff' in the toilet, the smell can be quite bad due to the lack of exhaust. Pool area was nice, it is, again, quite small, yet sufficient if you want to get a decent lap in the morning before your activities. We didn't take the breakfast package so could not comment on the food, but looking that the hotel is in Robertson Quay, there are tons of places to select to have a great food. It is a bit far from the MRT thought, which is quite a problem if you have to return late at night and taxi is hard to find. All in all, we would like to return to this place on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super chic”
Reviews.Author: Amanduhl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 730 from 22-24th July in the premier loft with my sister. We arranged for a twin sharing. Rather than sharing the double bed, the hotel converted the sofa bed into a decent single bed with linen & all. Friday night's sleep was bad & this sentiment was shared by my friends staying in room 744. The sounds of revving Lamborghinis and Ferraris coming from the street were clearly heard late at night when we returned to our rooms at about midnight. This was very frustrating but nothing that the hotel could do. We figured that this was due to location. There popular high-end club located just next door. Saturday's sleep didnt have the same problem thankfully. The breakfast buffet was included & the food was decent. I wish I could permanently stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for Us”
Reviews.Author: VLYC
Reviews.Content: We used to live around the Robertson Quay area before relocating from Spore. We saw this hotel being built and was curious to discover what it is like. In summary : we will recommend this hotel on the basis of accessibility and good value for an increasingly expensive city. The hotel concierge can up its game by providing better service in informing first timers to Singapore the many choices of things to do which are easily accessible from Studio M. We had no issue with the wireless internet connection. The room size is consistent with residential developments starting from 2007/08 - shoe box size apartment units. Bed is standard Queen size, pull out sofa bed is good for someone under 5ft 3in and toilet cubicle is a tight squeeze. No issue with shower and water temperature. An annoyance is request for morning call never came. Room is kept clean and tidy. Those looking for bigger rooms are better off booking with older properties.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible...”
Reviews.Author: keithfitz
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! The rooms are designed for mice (even the "Premium" loft is barely large enough for an adult hobbit. The rooms were designed by a moron. Part of the desk-top doubles as the landing step to get up to/down from the loft. I wonder how many laptops and phones have been stepped on in this hotel (and how many necks or backs broken in the process)... The toilet makes a phone booth seem luxuriously roomy, and don't drop the soap in the shower -- there is no room for anyone other than a small child (or abovementioned hobbit) to bend to pick it up, without stepping into the entry of the room. There is ONE plug anywhere near the desk. It is recessed into the desk and designed in such a way that there is no room for the cord, rendering it useless (I literally cannot used the plug in the desk..). Fortunately, there are two wall plugs on the other side of the room, where the luggage platform is. Undoubtedly useful for the housekeeper. Not so helpful for any guest who actually wants to use the desk. I am a business traveler who logs more than 250,000 miles a year, all over the world. And this is one of the most disappointing "hotels" I've ever seen. Avoid it, unless you happen to be a hobbit with a sever aversion to consumer electronics...

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, simply adore this hotel. Very unique with the bed on the 2nd level of the room. Loved the bay mirror in the room. Location wise not fantastic though the boat quay is within walking distance. There's shuttle bus to town but we didn't try that coz we just want to spend more time in the room. There's a nice pool n chilling area. Breakfast is not fantastic but they have the basic. Be prepared to queue for eggs though, long long wait just for egg omelette. I will certainly stay here again, just note that you may not like to stay here if you have kids, with the sharp corners n all, small toilet n bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleBuck888
Reviews.Content: Generally an acceptable (just) accommodation option. I travel with my employment and spend 6 months of the year in hotel rooms so unfortunately I know hotel rooms!. This trip was for a family holiday. Several things to be aware of though before you make a decision: 1. Some taxi drivers do not know where this hotel is located as it is only 1 year old and there is another hotel with a similar name (M hotel). 2. We booked a high room facing outwards and were given a low room facing inwards. Because we arrived very tired and late at night we did not follow this up. 3. As everyone mentions, yes the rooms are small. There are quite a few storage nooks and crannies we kept discovering during our stay (great for leaving things behind!), so exercise care. Yes the toilet closet or cubicle is small, when sitting on the throne you will only have a few inches (if any) clearance between your knees and the wall in front. We found it easiest to leave the door open to avoid claustrophobia and then needed to scoot sideways into the entry to pull pants up. To go number one in the middle of the night it is best to do that from the room entry (just outside the toilet cubicle) which is easily done for a male. Adds to family bonding and reminds me of camping with the family. 4. The shower that we had was a thrilling experience. Once the water temperature was set the water stream would switch between the temperature you had set and scalding hot. This would happen on a random yet continuous basis, averaging about every 30 seconds. I can only assume that this was the effect of other rooms turning taps on and off. I am not exaggerating and I know that this would be unacceptable if not illegal most places in the world. Because of this, my young children refused to take showers and had to be hand washed for the entire week long stay. Much to my childrens' amusement I braved the shower but there were plenty of screams and jumping out of the water stream to get washed. I have never encountered this before in 22 years of traveling the world and staying in hotel rooms 6 months per year. 5. The swimming pool is good for laps but no good for children. No shallow areas and very high sides. The "spa" was the same cold temperature as the main pool. Pool towels often unavailable. 6. High curtains make it impossible to completely close them. This creates privacy issues for the inwards facing rooms unless you like sitting in the dark. This also provided us with some interesting entertainment a couple of nights from opposite rooms in the building. Very much at he expensive of other unsuspecting hotel guests. 7. There is a master switch to turn off the room lights from the bedside upstairs. The problem with this is that it means that if anyone gets up in the night to use the toilet they have to do it in the dark, as the individual light switches will not work. Alternatively turn on all the room lights and disturb other sleepers. We generally chose the dark option but ensure your travel insurance is up to date as those stairs are steep! 8. This location is Robertson Quay close to Clarke Quay so there are plenty of good outside and riverside dining and bar options. It is also too far in my opinion from the MRT. Took about 25 minutes walk between hotel and MRT station in the humid heat each time we did it. It is also on a different line to the majority of other attractions. This involves a long underground walk to change lines to go one additional stop. Fortunately taxis are cheap. 9. Hotel cleanliness was average with he mandatory black hairs in the basin and bed sheets. 10. Other reviewers have mentioned unsmiling service. This is standard in Singapore in my experience. No bad intentions meant, I don't think, just busy trying to make another buck. We had an enjoyable time in Singapore overall. I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An absence of the Asian hospitality you love”
Reviews.Author: DannyHunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Studio M just last week with my partner in an premier loft and I have to say, we were not so impressed: - White white, and more white. The room lacked any colour, it was pine wood, some glass, and white. This might sound picky but take my word for it when I say, it felt cheap and uncaring - Two words come to mind when I think of the interior design. Ikea and Rice - The euro-styling might have been forgivable if it had felt like it still had class, elegance, or some level of care to it. But everything about the rooms screamed economy. - Perhaps the thing that I find most unforgivable was that the in-room dining. The in-room dining is supplied by a couple of different cafes surrounding the hotel. Pizza is available 6pm-10pm along with other main meals. Other dishes are available 24/7. The food was not at all objectionable, how ever! They are served in plastic containers with plastic forks and knives in packets. These take-away options took half an hour to arrive and were often luke-warm and destroyed by the sealed containers which did not allow moisture to ventilate. The evening I left I was served an hour after ordering, I was literally picking up the phone to find out what had happened to my order when the door rang. In her arms she had 4 other plastic square contained meals that she was taking around to others in the hotel, balanced vicariously on a small plastic tray. I was surprised she was actually capable of producing the receipt I needed to sign considering she had her hands so full. There was no smile, no apology for the time delay, she hardly said a word and it was obvious that this was not due to any language difficulties. - When asking for some ice to use for drinks a colleague was going to be charged $3 if he wanted it delievered - When asking if we could drink our own alcohol around the pool side we were told yes by reception then no by the staff on the recreation floor, then yes by reception again, then when arriving back we were restricted to only drinking on the poolside recliners despite the presence of lounges and sofas scattered across the unpopulated deck. - When wanting to order a poolside drink I had to search to find a waiter. I stood at the greeting desk for 2 minutes watching him tinker on the piano to pass the time, he seemed very bored. - Finally he got up and without glancing towards his work station, dragged himself away to the bar where I finally stormed over to deliver my order. - The poolside food is limited to 7-8 japanese entrées and 7-8 japanese mains. So you'd better like japanese if you should like to eat by the pool. - The pool itself is well sized considering the rooms. It has a nice outlook and remains out of the harsh sun for most of the day, yet presenting itself at times as it passes over the H shaped design of the building. - There's only JUST enough deck chairs so you best be okay with lounging next to a stranger - The gym is well appointed with everything you might need including provided towels. There's one of everything except the treadmills of which there are two - One evening we felt like some drinks at the bar, only to sit there for 15 minutes ringing the bell obnoxiously. We could hear people chatting away in the kitchen but not a soul came out to serve us, despite a chef eyeing us off as he walked back in presumably after a break. we gave up and went and grabbed our own drinks. - With night service so bureaucratic and unreliable, it was astonishing how efficiently they managed to end the buffet service at 10:30am sharp. Much of the packing began before this time in fact, and the staff seemed only too ready to pounce upon the food as the clock struck 10:30. One felt rather confronted as the frenzied stuff hustled plates and cutlery away. - The buffet food was quite enjoyable on an up note, and the outdoor undercover eatery is very pleasant. - The first thing you'll notice in the foyer of Studio M is the pungent fabricated floral smell, I apologise for not knowing the particular flower. There are orchids around however I'm convinced that they alone could not produce the slightly dizzying effect I experienced every time I walked in the door. - The staff are young, fluent in english, and featured in the most faux pas uniforms, consisting of transparent white shirts and grey vests that would make Kate Moss look fat. - The complimentary wi-fi had the "umph" and reliabilty of a budgerigar - Please note the plants featured in the rooms on the online pictures are NOT present - The beds are luxuriously comfortable, a serious upside to this hotel, though the radio/ipod clock was so extremely bright we has to use the complementary Bible to block it each night. In finishing, the attitude of the hotel was sadly economical, and efficient. In an asian hotel I relish the thought of their unsurpassed service, their beaming smiles, and humble offer to do anything necessary to make your stay more accommodating. In a european hotel one expects a particular level of class, knowledgeability, and elegance. Studio M's staff appeared as if they'd extracted the most undesirable parts of both services and combined them together, perhaps symbolised in their "Eeyore grey" uniforms. Their air of education came through as an inability to work beyond the framework of their clinical hotel policies. Their elegance came as silver coated plastic forks and knives, their class came in uber-modern interior design that was so white and clinical one felt oddly as if inside a designer hospital. The only staff member to make my day EVERY day, was the dear housekeeping girl who didn't speak a speck of english but went about her work with a genuine beaming smile, admirable diligence, and a serving attitude that made your heart melt. Out of sheer protest I would not recommend this hotel, it's plain, new, and efficient if you need a good stop over experience. However to stay there is to fund Millenium Copthorne and their endevour to create an asian hotel that symbolises values only europeans know how to execute. Asian hospitality is second to none, and it was very sad to see this product so clearly designed to make money with efficacy, rather than a hotel experience full of people passionate about the concept of their service

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: EnglishGirlinBangkok
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights here and was a little worried by some of the reviews. Fortunately we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very small and compact but very well designed. There was plenty of storage space with pull out draws under the bed, cabinets for toiletries and the whole upstairs for suitcases to be stored. The location is excellent - it is located at the quieter end of Clarke Quay but a 5 minute walk and you're in the hustle and bustle with more cafes and restaurants than you could hope for. The MRT was a 10 minute walk at a leisurely pace and it's a lovely walk alongside the quay. it is well hidden in the Central Mall so make sure you ask someone first. We didn't have much to do with the staff but any encounter was met with politeness and friendliness. Pool is a good size and a well equipped gym, plus free wifi and free access to several macs located around the hotel. All in all it was excellent valuer for money and in our opinion a much better place to stay than Orchard Road, we will definitely consider staying there again if we are back in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly different”
Reviews.Author: parklane44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 3rd until the 7th. We had 2 rooms for 4 adults and 1 child. The studio concept was quirky and reception staff were very accommodating and friendly. Price was excellent by Singapore standards and definitely value for money. Highly recommend, but be warned the stairs between the loft floors may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Service really needs to be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Paige022
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3days 2nights for a weekend getaway from the city. Had some considerations as the reviews were either really good/really bad. Anyway, a big hiccup right when i checked in - the lady at the check-in counter did not recognize a debit card. She charged it as a credit card. It was only after I realise that mistake did I inform her that I was using a debit card. The response I got was that the hotel usually only take credit card (hinting that i should not use a debit card?) and that is why they have problems with my debit card - Where is the flexibility? The transaction was done again and I asked specifically what about the transaction done before, and they said that no amount has been deducted (yes it has not been deducted it is being held!). And they say the amount will be released upon check out. Well, it wasn't and I have been making phone calls (to my bank and to Studio M) from 12noon till now and the problem still is not solved. Generally, the overall experience was fine except for another hiccup that when I went to dine at their cafe at the ground level, they overcharged me for another piece of cake which I did NOT order. And when I pointed out the mistake there were no apologies and the lady returned with the amount with an unhappy face (no smiles nor apologies). The rooms are exactly like what it is in the pictures, I found the mini size good as I prefer cozy areas. Breakfast was great and efficient - The hotel room service staff had really good smiles and I realise apart from the counter/reception area staff, all the other staff were really helpful and friendly, always smiling and making small remarks to guests which I really liked.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with young audience”
Reviews.Author: Urs68
Reviews.Content: Many young guests are in the hotel. The rooms are on two floors, however they are rather small and not very practicle. Toilet and shower were tiny and the stair to the bed upstair was narrow. All rooms have wireless internet which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel with 2-star staff”
Reviews.Author: WaltWhitman090
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in June, in a room on the 7th floor with a view on the atrium (= looking at the windows of the other leg of the building 30 meters across). The bed is a very good Queen-size, with an excellent duvet and pillows - and located on a loft within the room which you reach via a steep staircase. This makes is unsuitable for children. I slept like a baby because no bathroom of neighbors adjacent to my wall or other noisy facilities. The shower is pocket-size and in a sort of closet but of good quality while the toilet is in another small, similar closet opposite the shower. Biggest issue is where to store your towel because inside it's so small everything will get wet (outside the shower closet, there are 2 hooks). If you have a bit of a belly, you won't be able to make the turn into the shower. There was a small wash basin located at the left wall of the room, reinforcing the message that you shouldn't expect your usual hotel room set-up. I liked it. The fast and free Wifi worked splendidly but, as with many hotels nowadays, only allows one device to be using the wifi connection; as soon as your log in with your laptop, you mobile phone's wifi connection is gone. Didn't use the breakfast (too expensive) but there is a good Australian bar (Boomerang) next door that provides everything (and with A/C). The open-air terrace and pool are very nice in the evenings for a drink, a chat, and some surfing. The only set-back of this hotel is its staff. The reception staff is curd and provides the basic service, and employs a no-smile policy, bordering on snotty - are the customers there for the staff, or the staff for the customers? If you want something out of the ordinary, you will get it after some insistence. Might be that they are under-staffed (on several occasions there simply wasn't even a doorman/concierge to be found) but the Copthorne management has a job to do on the HRM here. I concluded that I was on my own in this hotel, and took it from there (= call my own taxis, and sort out where/how to walk/find things around the place). If they get the staff sorted, this place would be a winner. Next time, I'll try The Gallery next door, and see who wins overall.

Reviews.Title: “trendy small room but too far from MRT”
Reviews.Author: vok1
Reviews.Content: unusual room layout with a separate tiny toilet (think smaller than aircraft size) and separate shower, you have to get out of the shower and dry yourself in the room in the space between the shower and toilet. Hard to describe... Lovely bed BUT one side was against the window, bit awkward. Breakfast was nice served al fresco next to the pool area. Free wi fi was a plus. Staff were efficient and polite. OK expereience but it was too far from the MRT, a brisk 10 minute walk and while that may not sound much it is too far when you add in the sun and humididty as factors. Wasn't cheap either. Loved Singapore but next time will shop around for a hotel nearer one of the MRT stations.

Reviews.Title: “awesome - worth going again”
Reviews.Author: pointandshoot
Reviews.Content: Room: - Really cool & unique rooms; there's a mini-stairs beside the bed that brings you up a loft. - Loft has a small couch, a huge table, internet jack, and a chair. Presumably for business travelers but we didn't see any business travelers during our stay there; just a lot of couples. Maybe they can consider converting the loft into something more interesting. - Bed is big and comfortable & there's a reasonable selection of channels on TV. - Bathroom is separated from the toilet, and the sink is located in the main bedroom. Some may find that inconvenient. Location: - the hotel's a little outta the way if you are not gonna drive or get a cab; there is very little public transport. But it's located in a nice area with a decent number of eateries, cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dudsy00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights last year, and I loved how clean and unusual it was. Loft design was so unique and the bed was so comfortable. The location is superb, just mins away from local eateries and the many cafes and bars along Robertson Quay. I'll be staying here again in July 2011, simply because it's such a great hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MartinPe
Reviews.Content: Ah, the Studio M. Wonderful. Having stayed the night before at what I would argue is the world's worst hotel (Gingin Hotel, WA - see my review), we arrived at the absolute antidote to it. The Studio M is slick and well run. The staff are polite, friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the terrace was superb. Free internet of course. Our room was stylish, beautifully appointed and had a fantastic view. Great value. My wife and I loved this hotel - on our next trip to SG this is where we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: OzBoyzAustralia
Reviews.Content: We are on our last night of staying with Studio M in Singapore and I have to say it has been a great stay for us all. 2 adults and 2 kids (4yo & 8yo) whilst the room is on the small scale especially when you first walk in having stayed in the room for a week it really does work - very well designed and it is functional. You would not want to spend the whole day in your room with the kids but why would you, location is a liitle out of the way but that means it is quieter and less busy around the hotel which I like. A 10 min walk and you are at Clark Quay & The Central shopping centre where the train station is underneath and can get you anywhere so it is not too bad. Pool, gym area is nice, staff are busy but efficient and the couple of times we asked for things they got on it straight away so its all good on that front. Food is expensive, breakfast is average nothing amazing but it is ok, but at $20 each it soon adds up when paying for 4, cheaper to go across the road to the book shop cafe, read some magazines and great food or some other place. Free high speed internet is excellent! Singapore is good, very hot, sweaty and busy but it has some great things to do, it is expensive everything costs a good amount of money, they know how to charge, it's been good though !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Awesome Studio”
Reviews.Author: MacGrumpy
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. The room we booked was a LOFT studio - so the bed was upstairs, which wasn't such a big deal. I love the concept. The toilets are air plane sized tiny - but there was a nifty sliding door to block out the noise / smell / steam from the rest of the room :-) It is roughly 15 minutes walk to Clarke Quay (which also happens to be the closest MRT), or you can cab it anywhere for cheap in SG. Plenty of restaurants / cafes nearby. Catching cabs is easy on the main road. Surprisingly - the cafe downstairs was pretty affordable. Latte for SG $6 and a huge plate of lasagna for $15 ? Not bad for hotel prices. I read some comments about the noise level - but other than some noise from neighbors, I could not hear anything from the streets. Only major let downs for this hotel would be: - in the upstairs loft, the low ceiling not only blocked any air reaching the side of the bed closest to the wall... but I also kept hitting my head on the ceiling. - the WIFI required you to login each time you want to surf the net. For example, if you're using an iPhone then a Safari page would pop up and you would need to key in the user ID and password (case sensitive) each time - the window was huge, and it was tricky to completely close the curtains because it was so tall (reaching two floors!!) I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept”
Reviews.Author: jadeblevens
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and 3 year old son. I had read the reviews of this hotel so I was expecting the room to be small but they are VERY SMALL. With that being said the rooms are an interesting set up. The check in process wasn't a swift one. Even though I has prepaid the room it still took a while. The front desk staff were not friendly at all, they were not rude but they for sure didn't greet me with a smile or make me feel very welcome. It doenst seem like this hotel likes children and I don't recommend it for families with young kids. We chose this hotel because many hotels in Singapore only offer 1 King bed or 2 singles and that just dosent work for a couple with a child (unless you want to share a single or put the child on the floor). The Studio room we had had a queen size downstairs and a pull out sofa bed upstairs in the loft. As the stairs are very steep its just not safe for a child to sleep upstairs but the pull out sofa is very small and hard for an adult. I asked the front desk to set up the sofa bed and when they did they put a horrible scratchy thin blanket instead of a nice down one that was on the main bed. I called the front desk to ask for a down one and they told me they couldn't do that, I told them that they must have a spare one somewhere and they told me that they didn't and were really rude about it. I called down again to tell them that this was totally unacceptable and the girl said "whats unacceptable" like I was being unreasonable. I explained that I am in the hospitality industry and that I know they could find one off another bed in the hotel. Finally housekeeping brought me one, they were super apologetic and really nice about it in the end. If you stay here be warned, I thought I was opening a closet and it was the shower, then I opened what I thought was another closet and it was the toilet. Bottom line: - not suitable for young kids - very small room, you will spend most of your time in bed as the standing room is about the size of a closet - good for solo travellers or couples (no more that that in a room) - main bed is super comfy and great pillows and duvet - good coffee shop in lobby - lap pool in unique setting - gym If you are looking for something different, funky, unique and in a GREAT locations (right on Clarke Quay) and you have an open mind then this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location”
Reviews.Author: pdxexpat
Reviews.Content: Studio M is in a great location along the river, close to the Central Business District and lots of dining options. The rooms are small (loft style sleeping) but if you are not going to be hanging out in your room all day it doesn't really matter. The beds are comfortable and the place is quiet. There is a nice second floor outdoor area with a lap pool and dining area for breakfast. Breakfast is standard hotel fare but well done. Service is a bit hit or miss. Staff are nice but seem poorly trained and you are not certain that the phone will be picked up when you call for something

Reviews.Title: “Very cute loft...”
Reviews.Author: LuluGeelong
Reviews.Content: We read some of bad reviews about this hotel but we went ahead with it anyway because it allows 2 adults and 2 kids in 1 room without additional charge. Also some people mentioned that the service is not good, concierge was not there and receptionists took a long time to process check-in/out. But when we were there, it was alright. Receptionists and concierge were there when we arrived around 9.30pm. It was not super fast check-in but it was reasonable considering there were few other people checking in as well. Concierge was there to help us with our luggages into the room. The loft was very cute. It's a whole new concept of sleeping....The kids and I love it so much!! But my husband said the toilet and shower were too small. But at least they are separated. Also, I thought it was pretty safe for young kids like mine but may not be suitable for toddlers and elderly because you need to go up and down all the time. Location is a bit remote but taxi is everywhere and so cheap. And bus stop is only a few minutes from the hotel. If you're travelling with 3 other people, you might as well hail a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: cqth
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at Studio M and found that the hotel is such a hidden gem. Room was cozy and functional. It gave us a feeling of home away from home. Totally relaxed and away from all the hassle and bustle. Yet within walking distance to Clarke Quay and Chinatown. Service was friendly and efficient. WIFI Internet speed was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: rene2461
Reviews.Content: We were stopping over from London on our way to Australia and wanted a hotel that was clean and a bit different to the normal. We loved the loft room, and my 12 year old daughter thought it was cool, especially using the Apple computers that were available. Did not experience the noise problems others have but we were very tired. We got straight into our room after a long flight which was wonderful and were helped by a porter. Reception was helpful and efficient, but agree they could smile a bit more. The room is small and compact and watch out for stubbing toes and tripping over things.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & Stylish Stay Near CBD”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I was doubtful when I booked the Premier Loft for my business trip with a Drirector. It turned out to be a pleasant surpise despite the mixed review from travellers posted in TripAdvisor. I stayed one night at Studio M Hotel where my room was upgraded for free to an Executive Loft. It was very clean, simple but had all a business traveller needs after a strenous day of meetings and presentation speech. Unique design with a long desk for doing my computer work while being able to lean back to a side sofa to watch TV news. The bathroom and toilet are separated but they were designed to maximize the usage of limited space. Small but everything looked brand new. As I climbed up the staircase, the long glass panel of the window gave a good view of the river lightened up by street lamps by its bank. In fact, the glass window created a sense of spaciousness for a somewhat small room. One could sit at the staircase to stare at the night view of the river for a moment of serenity. The soft double bed upstairs is a 5-star treatment for a weary soul after work. The only setback were the alarm clock was faulty and no in-room slippers provided. My view is that the loft could be rather too small for two persons. In a nutshell, the loft was great and the breakfast spread was good. The price was reasonable as I do not need the hotel luxury which is often wasted in busy business trip. The loft was quiet though the hotel is within walking distance to many pubs & restaurants at Clarke Quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: CJTrousers
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I agree with other reviewers in this section. Studio M is just too noisy which is a shame as otherwise it's a stylish hotel with friendly, helpful staff and great facilities. My husband and I were in Singapore for two weeks on business but hoped to be able to relax in the evenings at Studio M. Not possible. Although you can enjoy peace and quiet by the pool during the day, at 6pm prompt, loud music starts to pump from about 8 speakers and this continues into the night. I spoke to staff several times about this and always got the same response: the music was turned down for 5 minutes then up went the volume again! Luckily, we were on the 9th Floor so found it possible to sleep and watch TV without too much bother. I pity those with rooms lower down. My only other niggle really was with the pre-booked breakfast which was let down by the quality of some of the ingredients (decent fruit juice would have been nice). Staff were friendly but unversed in spatial awareness and seemed more focussed on clearing tables (sometimes before guests had finished) than creating a pleasant atmosphere. That's not all the staff, by the way. The omelette staff were brilliant and a couple of the guys on checkout were ace as well. Finally, we visited the Ritz Carlton on our trip and were impressed by the fantastic (hot) jacuzzi. At Studio M, the jacuzzi is cold which (to me anyway) seems downright weird! So... nul points for certain key comfort points but otherwise a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rather stay in a chalet..”
Reviews.Author: SwaT01
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth but i had forgotten to request for a smoking room. Since i had already emailed them to make some arrangement for my partner's birthday, I said it was ok. By the way, they offer nothing complimentary ; birthday cake,upgrade or room decor ( petals, balloons )The only thing they offer is rose petals which is chargeable. i was baffled that the hotel did not have a cake i could purchase! I was carrying heavy bags but nobody offered me any assistance. I asked the reception if there was anyone to help & she said yes but did not call for anyone so i just carried it up on my own, i was so tired! The room was nice, lights, music were on. Beware! no bathtub here! Obviously the room had been prepped but the petals were very little ( i paid for them) & i realized the it would not be such a hassle to change the rm after all. i called for a room change.The reception,(which i think was the manager) , was to call me back once he checked availibility. but not only was luggage assistance not offered when he called back , they asked me to come down to get my keys! Terrible! Carried my heavy bags down once again to change the room, the concierge looked at me, offered no greeting & offered no assistance. I requested more petals & said I didn't mind to pay extra,but the manager said they had none more to offer! A while later once i got the rm decor done on my own, i headed out to get the cake & search for petals. The manager was kind enough to actually tell me the florist was just behind the block! When i came back, i requested for some cutlery to be sent to my room & a bucket of ice. A small ice bucket cost me $3. Never mind, but the reception told me i had to get my cutlery on my own at the cafe as it was not under them! And that room service was only for food! Outrageous! The only solace was late check out was not a problem though the manager had told us the day before that they were full house & could not give us late c/o. I would strongly suggest staying in a chalet instead of Studio M!

Reviews.Title: “Too Fast, Not Furious enough.”
Reviews.Author: beertblain
Reviews.Content: Great ambience at the lobby even though it doesn't carry that traditional "WELCOME" mat service. The check-in process was fast and details of the services are raw yet informative. Got an upgrade which is a bless since the studio loft is of a different configuration (bed on the 1st floor and couch on the 2nd; the premier loft is vice versa). Upon entering the room, I was a bit surprised. The photos are in fact deceiving (Point to be taken - to trust other reviews). The room was PETITE! Great camera skill and photo angles though. Thumbs up to the photographer. You shall excel in your future assignments. LOL! On the good side, I love small nooks and corners. The bath room and WC is just right for me. No bathtub and yes, it is just nice for one and twos a crowd; no advisable for claustrophobic individuals.Portions of hotel amenities are designed for one. No slippers (if you really need one on a fully carpeted floor), no comb, 1 bath robe. Have no idea if they charge for extra. You have to do a mini treasure hunt for these as they are stashed away neatly to keep up with the minimalist theme. Breakfast in the morning is another treasure hunt again. NIce simple continental + asian breakfast buffet. Too open and bright in certain areas. Can see dust particles everywhere since it is an open space. Comfortable timings at 6:30 - 10:30 a.m. Couldn't ask for more. Only that, I prefer a bigger glass for my orange juice 'cause it is too small and I need to go back and forth for my vitamin C. Would like to have a place like that (a bigger version of 'cos) and would like to come back again. 4/5 Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with user-unfriendly layout”
Reviews.Author: Nutsuda
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were lucky to get a complimentary upgrade from studio loft to premier loft as we booked for 3 nights. However, they advised that breakfast is included only for one person as there was one name in the booking (eventhough max room occupancy is 2 people). Breakfast for the 2nd person is S$20++. The second night, my other friends arrived and front desk said to them that they do not have a booking for them!? My friend didn't have a confirmation with them and the hotel couldn't bring up a booking by their surname. We asked them to call the travel agent to get a confirmation number, they told us to go to the room and make a phone call from there. We cannot use their phone to call! We provided them the confirmation number and the booking was there and they couldn't tell us why they couldn't find it at the first place. Room is nice and clean. However, the layout is a little bit strange. We had shower and separate toilet. Toilet is very small, you can hardly move. The sink is located outside in the living area (which I thought was strange). Tea, coffee, water were provided. Upstairs has a queen bed and tv. Some parts of ceiling is quite low. The main switch is located both upstairs and downstairs. The not so good thing about lighting is that you cannot turn the lights on in one area only. In the morning, I needed to turn on the light for the shower only but I couldn't. The whole room was lit up and it disturbed my friend who wanted to sleep still. Studio M is surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars and is around 10-15 mins walk to Clarke Quay MRT station. Getting a taxi here is also easy.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet on the outside”
Reviews.Author: Incoming11
Reviews.Content: Fun little hotel. The room was small but well laid out and as per expectations from the website. We found it quiet and both slept well.
