Judging by other reviews the key is to get a room facing outward rather than in towards the pool/bar with the U-shape design. Despite the lack of a nearby MRT it is perfectly walkable to the city centre and neighbouring Robertson and Clarke Quays. Add to this the hotel shuttle service and Singapore's numerous and cheap taxis, the location is good. The multi-night discounts make this reasonable value for Singapore and well-worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best, small rooms almost cell like....”
Reviews.Author: SEABoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior loft - don't be fooled, it's not as lavish or funky as it sounds. Over 2 floors, the ground consists of a small open area with adjoining separate shower and toilet, both of which feel extremely pokey. The desk area and small sofa are somewhat wasted and the downstairs is not somewhere you want to stay and sit. The upstairs is a bed - and not much else. Very small space with hardly enough room to walk around. However, the bed was quite comfortable and the sheets/pillows well laundered and provide for a good night sleep. Poor value but great location - ok if you want to spent all day out and just go back to sleep but dont't expect somewhere to relax. We didn't use the pool or experience the restaurant although the lobby area is kinda cool and funky (ish). Room service was overpriced and of poor quality. Better value hotels exist out there is you shop around online.

Reviews.Title: “Snow White, iLike”
Reviews.Author: MadMichi
Reviews.Content: Room: got upgraded to queen size corner room. clean, stylish, sleek, professional,business like, the ideal room for couples and friends, but not so for a family with kids. the bed is located up the stairs, fun initially, but lazy to walk down for a pee in the middle of the night. P.s: ceiling may be knocking your head when u go to bed. downstairs, a cloth rod for you to hang your clothes, and shoe racks, decent 2-in-1 basin for toilet/kitchen coffee needs. Just as it is named, Feels like a studio home with high ceiling, not just another square box room to sleep and go. I love how everything is applised, the docking station, and apple-friendly imacs all around. If you are an apple fan, this is your apple hotel. I get views of the condos opp the road. Facilities: airy, basic pool. basic gym. the similiar hotel design layout reminds me of Quincy hotel. Breakfast: Disappointing. I could do better with hot American breakfast spead than just basic continental and very few selections of hot food. Restaurant: a small cafe at the lobby, self-sufficient. Service: Very good overall. Though room service forgotten our request for bucket of ice and had to remind them again. Location: 10min walking distance to Singapore River and Clarke Quay. Need we say more? Smoking: Whole hotel is non-smoking. Cheers. Parking: free/sheltered.

Reviews.Title: “No room!”
Reviews.Author: FD41
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9.30 pm from Australia, completed the full checking in procedure to find that there was no room for me, despite having confirmed my booking with a credit card. As I stayed here in January I was pretty annoyed, and also that they had made no attempt to contact me. Not a nice thing to do to a lone female! I stayed the week at Marina Bay Sands instead which was much, much nicer. I come to Singapore about 4 times a year and will never stay at Studio M again.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly but ok for a stop over.”
Reviews.Author: zippydamct
Reviews.Content: The Hotel overall was Ok. The toilet is tiny as is the bathroom, no sink in toilet. Far from the MRT and I had no issues with the staff. What got me was how sharp every part of th room was, don't stay here if you have children or if you are prone to banging your big toe / shins on things. The whole loft idea was a good idea but badly executed.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil urban haven”
Reviews.Author: Meerabel
Reviews.Content: I loved this boutique hotel. Even though it was in a busy area, inside the hotel it was cool and peaceful - perfect to switch off after a long day in the city. The loft-style rooms are the perfect blend of comfort and minimalism, tastefully decorated in-keeping with the tranquility of the hotel, and the beds are the most comfortable I have slept in. The open-sided terrace restaurant is a revelation of modern Japanese cuisine, with a range of delicious tapas, mains and original Asian-inspired cocktails. The service in the hotel was impeccable, the staff were unfailingly friendly and attentive and picked up on my habits. For example, every morning I drink a cup of hot water and lemon; after the second morning, I only had to set foot in the restaurant before my drink would appear. There is a lovely open decking area next to the restaurant which is filled with comfortable seating, water features, tropical foliage and cosy nooks, with a decent lap pool and jacuzzi at the end. There is also a very small but decent gym (which sadly lacks a/c). Among my few gripes: * Reception, which was typically understaffed for checking in and out, and where some staff were less helpful than others. * Far from the MRT station - 10-15 minutes walk, which is tiring at the end of a long day lugging a laptop and bags, walking through the bustling Clarke Quay in 70%+ humidity. Cabs are not easy to come by at the station unless they are pre-booked. * The split-level rooms may not be for everyone - I'd be surprised if the stairs had not caused previous accidents. *I forgot to pick up some items from my room when I checked out, and I was unable to recover these afterward - even though I knew exactly where I had left them, the staff told me they had not been found. This was a shame, a disappointing end to an otherwise thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Woodbury729
Reviews.Content: There is one word to describe my experience at this hotel - SUCKS. The room are horribly laid out. The noise from adjacent rooms and the pool area is unbearable. Worst of all, the reception staff act like they are the customer and you need to cater to their needs. I am also drafting a letter to my HR Manager and asking her to remove this hotel from our coporate approved hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel but reception staff not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: RoamingKiwi_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights on a stopover from Auckland to London. Decided to try it as it looked modern and funky, a bit different from a standard hotel room. The price was reasonable also, particularly for Singapore. The rooms are great. Really well designed and the bed is super comfortable. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are probably better enjoyed as a solo traveller as they are quite small. The toilet and shower rooms (two separate rooms) are about the size of a toilet on an airplane but actually I didn't mind this at all. The gym, lap pool and outdoor area are amazing and you really feel like you are having a treat using these facilities. The one major problem the hotel currently has is the attitude and competence of the reception staff. For reasons I can't explain, the staff are not warm and welcoming. It's almost that they thing it is "cool" to not smile and come across as being cold and dismissive. Its quite odd for Singapore as other hotels I have stayed at there the staff have been extremely friendly, smilely and helpful. And, in terms of competence, this seems very low for a hotel of this standard. There always seemed to be a long check out queue and when I came to check out it took ages (and lots of questions being asked amongst the various reception staff) despite my booking having being prepaid through Expedia. I would stay again but they really need to invest in some basic staff training - smile and make the customer feel important and get those competence levels up.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly designed”
Reviews.Author: Nic777
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Hotel last night. The environment inside the room was very noisy due to a party going on outside below our room. The rooms are arranged in a U shape around an open space where the swimming pool and a bar are located. This means that any noise reverberates between the rooms making for a rather unrelaxing and unpleasant environment. This was made worst by a woman screaming into a microphone with a voice which was like fingernails down the proverbial blackboard. The noise seemed to continue until well after midnight. Besides from the noisy environment I'd say that the rooms were average if a little on the small side and the customer service was up to the usual standard if nothing special. Location was okay but a little on the edge of the action.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here if you want a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: roundheadgirl
Reviews.Content: I am writing to warn fellow travelers about this hotel. On a recent stay, I was sadly disappointed not only by the management but also by the accommodations. The room itself was very small and strangely designed. There was barely any room to move within the room and the desk being in the "loft" space was quite awkward. However, my main concern with this hotel was the noise. The night we stayed there was an event in the open air restaurant area of the hotel. It was so loud, we couldn't hear the tv. I talked to management and they apologized for the noise but within an hour the loudspeaker was back on encouraging the people at the event to cheer and scream. This loud noise continued well into the night. This hotel needs to re-look at their purpose. Are they an outdoor events center or a hotel? At this point I would say outdoor events center!

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hotel, good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Buick54
Reviews.Content: The original Hotel we booked for 3 nights was undergoing renovations so we hastily web surfed Trip Advisor for a replacement and with the help of a couple of destination experts chose this one. Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and efficient and presented very well in their uniforms. The reception lobby although sparse was nice and modern. After check-in we proceeded to the 9th floor and upon opening the room door we were instantly awed by the lightness and brightness of the room, a welcome after the gloomy hotel we had just come from. We were lucky, our room faced south with views of the river and Clark Quay , Flyer and even Marina Bay Sands hotel in the distance. It was real bonus at night with all the lights. Karma after the disappointment of the hotel near Chinatown. The room layout itself is a bit weird. Credit to the designers for thinking of something different but there is too little space downstairs and too much wasted space upstairs. Ok if only one person who is on a business trip and can utilize the upstairs lounge / computer station facility. A bit squeezy downstairs , needs more storage for bags, clothes etc. Good tea/ coffee making facilities, mini fridge and modern electronic safe that is easy to use. Separate Toilet / shower cubicles and a bit cramped but ok. Nice pool , outdoor decking area to chill out, read etc. Buffet breakfast included, good selection for everyone. Not 5 star but hey, how much can you eat anyway. The hotel is in a great location, just far enough away from the maddening crowd of Clark Quay. It's about a 15 minute easy flat walk to the MRT station. The Hotel is still fairly new but there are some short comings with some workmanship, quality of materials in the rooms so I would recommend you stay there whilst it still has that new feel.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: BaliTokyo
Reviews.Content: Foremost, be assured to mention "Studio M Hotel at Nanson Road" as there is also an "M Hotel at Anson Road" to your taxi driver. The hotel is close to Clark Quay and there is no MRT station nearby. We arrived at 1am in Singapore and were driven to the wrong one. We booked a standard room with a mezzanine floor equipped with a sofa-bed, which was perfect for my daughter. It was a 2 nights stay, and although the room is tiny, we were satisfied with our stay. The receptionist was very kind and the housekeeping did a good job. The pool is GREAT. One glitch - the porter (and receptionist) forgot our luggages upon check-in so after waiting for 20 minutes in our room my husband decided to go to the lobby and came back with the luggage himself. No apologies from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for long stay”
Reviews.Author: SLTW
Reviews.Content: Interesting room design, loft. Bed on the lower level with sofa and desk on top. Shower room and toliet are separed.. Open sink and mirror. feel comfortable with high celing and big window. Location is a bit remote.. Not close to any mrt. But taxi is quite a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfectly formed.....”
Reviews.Author: UKEscaper
Reviews.Content: It is a relatively new hotel, it is always very clean, the staff are excellent, but the rooms are small. The design of the hotel, has the rooms on two levels, beds downstairs, desk up or vice versa. I changed from a Studio Loft to a Premier Loft, in which the work area was downstairs and the bed on the loft level. Call me old-fashioned but that is the way I prefer it. What I found was that although the room is small, the shower and toilet in two separate enclosed areas, was that I actually had plenty of room for what I needed. The large desk area was excellent to spread out. I was supplied with extra hangers for clothes and plenty of space in the drawers for clothes. I suppose when you think of more premium hotels and the large rooms, how much do you really need?! Aside the excellent condition of the hotel and quality of service, the major winning point for me is the location. North of Clarke and Robertson's Quays, the area is quiet enough to relax, but plenty of bars and restaurants to stroll out by the river to. Just sit, read, watch the world go by, or walk down the river to the touristy areas. I would always go for a Premier room and above, you get more room to move around, although the rooms sizes are about the same. I am a bit concerned about giving the hotel too good a review, for the value (as Singapore hotels are getting very expensive) I will always stay here, but want to make sure there is room for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: Steph1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Friday night and was given a room over looking the interior courtyard where the swimming pool was. To our surprise the Hotel had hired out the courtyard for a private party. The music was extremely loud and you could feel the bass reverberating through your body while lying on the bed. It was so loud you could not even hear the TV. This racket went on till well after 11 pm. Don't know what idiot thought it was a good idea but according to one member of staff it is a common occurrence. Obviously the hotel doesn’t rate the comfort of the guests ahead of making a buck from a private function.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably noisey”
Reviews.Author: smoregate
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore after a long flight and just wanted to sleep. Instead we were kept awake by a very bad singer at an open air bar right outside our window. Even though the bar was part of the hotel when we complained to the front desk they basically said they weren't responsible for he bar and they couldn't do anything about it. Unbelievably poor service. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary.”
Reviews.Author: Faranadia
Reviews.Content: Room, ambience and pool is perfect. However, i would strongly would like to highlight that they should improvise on ROOM Service, seriously. The food are served in "microwave plastic containers", when we pay full price of a room service with service chrge. However the food is still in good standard!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value of Money - overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: daikimatsu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels world over so this was kinda new. Every room in this hotel is kind of a double story loft. If you are sick of staying in bland business hotels (like I was) - then this could be a good option for you. Work on one floor and sleep on the other. Don't get high hopes though - the loft is quite small (only good for one person) but it's definitely worth the money you spend here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_AU
Reviews.Content: Studio M hotel is one of the newer hotels in Singapore and is conveniently located in Robertson Quay. I booked a studio room but got upgraded to an executive room which has enough space for one, if not two people. The bathroom arrangement is very different to normal hotel rooms, with the toilet, shower and sink/basin all in separate locations. One great thing about the room is due to the loft design it has a high ceiling. The high ceilings result in long windows which let a lot of natural light in. This is great compared to many other hotel rooms with smaller windows and lights that need to be turned on all the time. My room was on a corner which gave a great view across Clarke Quay out towards the Singapore flyer. Breakfast was included in the rate and was of standard fare. Nothing exceptional but a wide variety which is all I ask for. Dinners are not problem at all being close to excellent restaurants in Robertson and Clarke Quay. The nearest MRT station (Clarke Quay) is a 10-15 minute walk away which makes transport around Singapore easy. There is a large swimming pool that can be used for laps if you want to, the gym is small but well equipped. There is also a large outside deck area by the pool which is covered and has comfy seats and sofas, perfect for that afternoon drink with a book/magazine/laptop. Wi-fi is throughout the hotel, not just the room which is great. All in all, I really enjoyed the 5 day stay at this hotel and will probably stay here again as the prices are very good compared to other hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: rcvvcr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my parents last June 2010. The hotel interior and exterior is pretty nice, relatively new. I just noticed that the elevators are small. The room is pretty cool since it has 2 floors. I'm just not sure if all rooms are the same. Bathroom is small. The staff are not very friendly compared to other hotels we've been through but this is not a big deal. They offer a free shuttle that will take you to china town, etc. Just ask for the schedule from the staff. Location wise, very good as well since it's walking distance to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfotable hotel if you're on your own”
Reviews.Author: pooky34
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Studio M for 1 night during my stopover in Singapore. I have stayed at the M hotel before and the good experience at the M hotel made me book Studio M. However the atmosphere at the Studio M was quite different from Studio M. I felt unwelcome at my late arrival and there really was lack of front line staffs at this hotel. The room was interesting and the loft was okay. I would recommend this hotel if you are a solo or a couple. The room itself was very small compared to other hotels in Singapore and don’t even mention about the shower. If you are planning to stay at Studio M, remember that the shower and toilet is very small! Also it is quite far from the MRT so you might need to take a cab back and forth. If these doesn’t bother you, Studio M can be a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: Zappa1959
Reviews.Content: On our way home to Amsterdam after a few weeks in Thailand, we decided to stay in Singapore as I always do on the Singapore stopover package. I have always stayed at another hotel, but this time I decided to stay here, as it looked good on the website. Upon arrival at the hotel there was a row of people waiting to be checked in , and no porter, all had to carry their own luggage up to their rooms, and we had a few pieces. When we got to the room we were blown away on the size ...SMALL. (a box size shower room and a seperate box for the WC and no real storage space ) If you are traveling with a family,this would not be for you. There was nothing in the mini bar(found out later that you have to pay more for the room to get that stocked), no room service menu (had to go to reception to ask for it). Anyway to cut a long story short, will I stay here again...no is the answer, will go back to my old place round the corner. They really need to up the service at this place otherwise people will not be returning after their first stay..

Reviews.Title: “small yet quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanna4ever
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel located at the CQ. My son loves the hotel that he could go up and the view is good! The design of the hotel is great that they could bring in the sunlight which is fantistic. Even though the room is small and found it is diffcult to organize our stuff, the bed is so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Loft is dirty and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: strawberryshortcakez
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 24 Dec and because of the loft concept. However, I was utterly disappointed and regretted my decision to stay here. I know that this is a peak period but I would still expect a good quality from the hotel because of the amount i paid for. When we climbed up to the cleaned bed, we found a few strands of hair (not ours) on the bed under the quilt cover. Also, the shelves were not cleaned. We could see visible dust and feathers on the shelves. The glass panels were als stained with tea/water marks. Overall, we did not enjoy our stay and with the kind of money paid, I could have opted for another hotel to stay that could be far more cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Awkward!”
Reviews.Author: miraiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Studio M for 9 nights on a first time trip to Singapore on business. The hotel is new, however, my particular room already showed some signs of wear. The location is good; walking distance to the Clarke Quay and Boat Quay areas, where all of the restaurants, shops, and night life seems to be. Some of the taxi drivers still don't know where this hotel is so I suggest that all guests carry the address along with you. The service wasn't too terribly bad, but personally, I am not particular type who really likes a lot of pampering. If you're looking for a lot of extras, and top quality service, you probably won't find it here. That's all I really have to say that is remotely positive about this hotel. Studio M in general has a very awkward and hard to use layout. It looks modern and sleek at first glance, but after about an hour of being in the room, you start to discover how user-unfriendly the place really is. And the longer you stay, the more frustrated you get with some of the oddities that this room has. For example, in order to activate the power to the room, you have to slide your key card into a little slot in the light switch located by the front door. I found this to be quite convenient, because I tend to lose my key all the time. This way, I always know where to find my key. However, the bad part is, that every time I leave the room and take the key out of the slot, it shuts down ALL power to the room. The air con, clock radio (which is really annoying because it never keeps the right time, and is much too bright. And since its glued to the desk, you can't turn it away from you. Get rid of it! Its out dated, not compatible with new iphones and ipods, and just place usless!) , the lights, all wall sockets -EVERYTHING! That means that every time I return to my room, the room is really hot and humid and takes a while for it to cool down. On top of that, the air con's temperature settings always resets itself to 22 degrees which is much too cold, especially when the vents are right above my bed blowing frigid air on me. This means that if I forget to raise the temperature before I go up to my loft, I have to climb all the way down the really scary stairs again and set the temperature. Another thing is, I have a lot of electronics with me (my laptop, iphone, digital camera, etc.) so since the whole room powers off when I leave, I can't charge my devices while I am away. The room's layout is little to be desired. I thought it was interesting at first, but after about the third day, it got to be a real annoyance. I really don't don't get the loft concept because in my opinion, it is a really poor utilization of available space. I think it would have worked much better if the loft was a full sized floor, hence a two story room instead of a one and a half story room. This way you have some storage space for suit cases or perhaps a more spacious living space on the second floor. Instead, I get a very small sleeping area, and a small living area. But the one thing I found to be more awkward than anything else were the stairs. This is an accident waiting to happen! There were times I thought I was going to trip and fall. And since the bottom of the stairs is basically the top of the writing desk (which is also very odd) and the big glass window, it just screams serious injury for those who aren't too coordinated. Another accident that is bound to happen sooner or later is the glass partition next to the bed that keeps you from tumbling to the ground below. Well, its pretty useless. Although there is a sticker that reads "don't lean against the glass" someone is bound to do it, and if that glass gives away, there will be serious injury (just a heads up to management if you're reading this). Replace the glass with more sturdy railing. Or better yet, expand the floor space a bit more so that you have more space to walk. Overall, I wouldn't say it's a horribly bad hotel. If you plan to stay for only 2 to 3 days, don't really care about service, and just want to be within walking distance of all of the action, then maybe its worth a go. But any more than that, I would suggest finding a more conventional hotel with more conventional layouts (unless you like stuff like this). That's what I'll be doing on my next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: mayks
Reviews.Content: The room was small duplex, but very clean and nicely furnished in a minimalist style. If you want to enjoy Singapore, you need to get out a lot and visit places. Then you go back to this hotel to refresh or get a quality sleep. If you plan to spend most of the time in the hotel, then this may not be to best choice. They do not seem to have a lot of staff, but all were very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out were each done in less than 5 minutes. Location is walking distance from Clark Quay, so you can always find a reason to drop by there first before finishing the night. Taxis are easy to find, although the common problem we experienced was that most taxi drivers did not know immediately where 'Studio M Hotel' was when we were heading back from other places. But once you mentioned "Moh. Sultan Rd" on Robertson Quay, they will bring you to the right place. In overall, if you need to perfectly balanced hotel with reasonable price in Singapore and do not have problems with small spaces, then you should consider Studio M.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet convenient”
Reviews.Author: adrianandrewlim
Reviews.Content: Feels like I am constantly in an airplane but it was ideal for both of us because (1) its near Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay and you can hop on the MRT from Clarke (2) its a direct bus ride to Orchard Road (the concierge was helpful to let us konw which bus to hop on (3) Its a walk away to Zouk (the nightspot) There is free WIFI and the breakfast was nice. BUT if you are late for breakfast, be prepared o share your table with others.... The bathroom was really small (and it was hilarious how we had to adjust to tight room) All in all, it was a nice room for the amount we paid

Reviews.Title: “if you like staying in a box .......”
Reviews.Author: adl_traveller_77
Reviews.Content: very modern and brand new - but i felt like i was staying in shoe box. Other travellers have correctly identified that toilet and shower room was small. The toilet room was a small as one found on an airplane. The actual amount of floor space was enough, but the split level made it almost impossible to properly relax. This would have been ideal if i was away on business and alone, but for a couple this place is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Studio M”
Reviews.Author: tank62
Reviews.Content: The relatively new Studio M hotel is well positioned close to Robertson and Clark Quay. The only difficulty we had was arranging extra linen for our 9 year old who was sleeping in the loft. Otherwise all was good, friendly, polite and professional staff. Normal checkin is 2pm but we arrived on an early flight from Australia and dropped off our bags and went for a walk. At 10.30 am we returned to find we could move in to our room, 3 and a half hours early, which was much appreciated! All in all a good experience, has lap pool and outdoor lounge area great place to relax after the long walks and shopping that is Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Dramatic rooms, not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Gamemaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife while I was at a conference. Overall a quite good, unremarkable hotel, except for the room layout. The entry level had a desk, sink, tv, very tiny toilet room and fairly small shower, and stairs leading up to a loft. Only a bed and tv there. With shades drawn, a stunning, dramatic view with 2 story high glass (we were in a corner unit, so glass to your front and side going down. Great, until you are going downstairs in the middle of the night, jetlagged and a bit unsteady. Definitely not recommended for those afraid of heights or clumsy, fine and even welcome otherwise. A bit far from MRT but taxis are cheap in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/bad location”
Reviews.Author: evo5dave
Reviews.Content: Robertson Quay is one of the better locations in Singapore. Of the three quays (Clarke and Boat being the other two), Robertson offers the quieter and more attractive experience. Studio M is on the corner of Nanson Road and Mohamed Sultan Road. The latter is relatively busy 24 hours a day so the hotel is subject to traffic noise. It also suffers from what I can only describe as the sound of extra-loud karaoke. From where this emanates I don't know but it is quite intrusive. Demolition and construction is a national pastime in Singapore and many buildings are deemed ripe for demolition after about 15 years. As such everything is built to last for about that period. This is particularly apparent in the rooms in Studio M. In terms of the bathroom fittings etc, it is clean but the formica fittings are covered in extensive scuff marks making the entire room look dirty. There is a shower cubicle, a separate toilet, with a sink in the main room itself. So three locations for bathroom fittings: very odd. The shower is small but ok. The toilet is tiny. Pulling up your pants in there is next to impossible! The room itself is on two levels with the upper part consisting of a little office and sofa. I liked this layout very much but, if I had been travelling with a partner, there would have been next to no room for luggage without dragging some up the stairs to the upper level. The choice of cable channels is very limited and the wifi (free!) connection is very slow. The room service prices, on the other hand, are (for a hotel) very reasonable and the food is very good quality. The hotel staff are very polite and helpful and I was particularly impressed with the maid on my floor who knew my name and was always keen to help point me in the direction of wherever I was going. Having read my review you may think I did not like this hotel very much but, all in all, the plus points outweighed the minus points and I did enjoy my stay. If you are alone, the rooms are cool and funky. If you're with a partner, you may want to consider a more traditional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I've ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: chillipepper16
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Yes it is small, but we were only there for 2 nights, so that was fine. And we're not huge - which helps! The bed was absolutely amazing - THREE mattress toppers and a gorgeous feather duvet. So comfy and we slept brilliantly (maybe the 14 hour flight from London had something to do with that too!). We stayed on the top floor (9th) and the views were stunning. The pool was great too. Perfect to cool down after a hot day's work trawling all the sights! Staff were very helpful. Got the Singapore Hotels bus from the airport, door to door service - great. Taxi's were cheap and great to get in the air conditioning from the 34 degree heat. The MRT was a bit of a walk away, but a nice walk along Clark Quay. Close to great restaurants and bars. Great having an Illy coffee bar downstairs in the hotel. Overall, a great stay. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but small”
Reviews.Author: tango-alpha
Reviews.Content: Having read the conflicting reviews of this hotel we decided to give it a go as we had previously stayed at the Park Hotel so know the area quite well. the hotel itself is very new having opened in April this year so not much wear and tear as yet. it is well located near a bridge corssing the Singapore River and is very convenient for bus travel, although the MRT is a 15 walk away. We had the room configuration where the double bed is on the lower level and the sitting / lounge area on the mezzanine level accessed by a staircase at the foot of the bed. The hotel blurb says its 22 sq m and here's what it translates:: There's a small entrance hallway as you enter the room - this doubles up as your changing area after a shower, which is to the right and the WC to the left. Both these are tiny hence the need to dress in the hallway - there's a courtesy sliding door to seperate this area from the bed area if modesty requires! The bed itself along with a small sink and under storage area takes up the rest of the lower level. The bed is tucked right up against the floor to ceiling glass window so whoever sleeps on that side cannot get down except by sliding off the foot of the bed. Up short flight of stairs is a desk with internet connections and a small sofa which converts to a bed if necessary. All in all it was perfectly adequate for our needs but I would choose the other configuration where the sitting area is below and the bed up top if I were to visit again - costs SGD20 extra per night. The rest of the hotel was a delight - lovely pool area, friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Contempo design with strategic location!”
Reviews.Author: Fardee
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for a night to celebrate my partner birthday! The premier room was cosy, perfect for couples! The breakfast was pretty normal, limited choices of food, overall average. Check in service was okay, staff was not friendly when giving me details about deposits and additional charges. However, great location with nearby fine dining, convinence store. Will definitely stay here again! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location, interesting room but poorly designed bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mattkieffer
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a perfectly decent hotel for a short stopover, good value with the deals on at the time of booking whilst the bed was great and comfortable and the location reasonably close enough to restaurants and bars along the river. As someone else has mentioned there were very slippery polished wood stairs in the room which seemed to be worryingly positioned in front of the large window. The room layout was certainly interesting, although the balcony upstairs with small desk and chair seemed a bit of a waste of space whilst there was not much space to store luggage or hang clothes. The bathroom however is however very badly designed, a tiny coffin like shower room which seemed to have no ventillation and a separate toilet in a room that was so small that you end up knocking your knees on the wall when you sit down! All in all perfectly fine for a short stay but probably not for any extended period of time.

Reviews.Title: “very modern and cute”
Reviews.Author: tollkuhn
Reviews.Content: Well designed rooms and as someone said it was an ikea experience. Woke up in the morning and rolled over to the floor to ceiling window overlooking the city.Wow what a view. Close to river walk and nice cafes and restaurants. free high speed wireless internet. This was a one night stopover and the hotel was perfect for that. Just be careful with the loft stairs, no handrail and polished steps. Staff were friendly but not very organised.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, Living in a Ikea Store Experiance”
Reviews.Author: jpr2777
Reviews.Content: I had booked myself into the hotel for 3 days initially to see whether I liked the ambiance of the hotel. Very nice newly built hotel with friendly staff. Room and shower room were rather small, however the free wifi internet made up for that. the double bed was very comfortable and clean. Location was perfect, restaurants and shops were just walking distance, however the closest underground station was about 15 minutes walk. I had searched the internet for another hotel around the same area with the same facilities and price, nothing compared so booked myself in for another 3 days. ps. would not recommend the room for couples unless you intending to spend your holiday site seeing. Buffet breakfast: Not so good for the price. There are so many restaurants close by (2 minute walk) which offer a range of exciting foods at affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeonjuL
Reviews.Content: Staying Aug 18~Sep 17, 2010. 200SGD/night, Free breakfase, WiFi internet as well as two pieces of laundry per day (not accumulative)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you are a first time visitor to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Arulg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 19th to 22 nd oct, the front desk staff unhelpful, studio loft where I stayed is un practicable, stair case to loft is slippery, bathroom and toilet is too cramped if you fat this room is useless, front desk staff do not know about the local places if you ask them they will either mis guide you or will not respond, no news papers., the printed front desk calling number may not work, younhave to search some other numbers or youmhave tom go down to front desk in person to serve yourself. I simply do not recommend this hotel, let god save you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 61malcolm
Reviews.Content: This is a modern very clean and stylish hotel. Very comfortable bead . Infiniter thread count sheets, nice studio type layout. Bar and pool are really cool, day or night. nice staff free internet, close to river. quiet just away from Clarke quay. Stay her and enjoy. check for o0ffers, you can get good rates

Reviews.Title: “M is for Misery”
Reviews.Author: HarryB44
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Singapore for several years and traveled in the region extensively, I had heard about this hotel from the other Millennium hotels in which I have stayed. All seem to be slipping in overall service and Studio M is no exception. On late evening arrival, I waited for check-in service for about 20 minutes. One of the reception staff was courteous but the other more senior staff seemed to hate her job and didn’t mind showing it throughout our stay. Up to the two-storey lofted room I went and found an aircon system on the fritz, and the desk phone out of order. Now, having to climb the stairs to the loft, to find the other telephone, I called reception for resolution - my luck, I got the unhappy one. After waiting 15 minutes, I called again, and was told they were on their way. Another 2 minutes passed and two maintenance fellows turned up with a ladder and into the ceiling they went. At this time the phone rang and because the loft stairs are so narrow, as is the overall room small, I was blocked by the maintenance men on the ladder. By that time they had somehow short circuited the lights and they all went out. Now, trying to navigate my way down the stairs, around the maintenance guys, and in the dark, I had had enough. I went back to reception, and asked for a new room, and was given one begrudgingly. Finally getting into my new room I found it less than clean, the bathroom and shower are literally smaller than 1X1 meter separate closets, the dreaded stairs to the paralyzingly small loft where the bed is is a nightmare when you need to make the trip to the toilet in the middle of the night. Curtains are floor to ceiling and you need to walk across the top of the desk to draw them fully!... you really have to see this room to believe the design. Only way to watch TV is from bed because it’s in the loft. Housekeeping staff replaced used coffee spoons and cup without washing. Other bad features included S$3 for a small bucket of ice, no closet but instead two hangers on a rod, mold/mildew on bath tiles, about a dozen pinch points between getting in the main door and into the bath and shower and a car park system that frequently charges your cash card when using the complimentary car park coupons. This is far from what I expected in a 4 star hotel in a major Asian center. This will be my last stay here for sure. Definitely overpriced, uncommonly unhelpful staff for Asia, and uncomfortable quirky rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STEVE78iPSWICH
Reviews.Content: It seems you either love it or you hate it and we LOVED IT. Although we arrived very early we were met with a smile and efficiently checked in by Joey on reception. As we were six hours too early – we were offered an upgrade – thank you studio m! Then we encountered our only hiccup of our stay as our bags got to our room before us – not sure if we can blame it on the jet lag or stupidity but we couldn’t work out how to operate the lifts ! For safety reasons you have to insert your card to get above the second floor. We liked the rooms! The design gives them a real airy feel and a refreshing change from your boring standard hotel room. Storage is a premium with lots drawers and hidy holes everywhere. Toilet and shower are great, good size fridge, easy to use safe and a truly scrumptious bed. All the staff we encountered were very efficient and friendly especially housekeeping. On one occasion we reported a broken bulb which was immediately replaced while we were out at dinner. The hotel is in a great location – we were there for the F1 and we walked everywhere. Chinatown, Raffles, Marina Bay etc so a short 10 min stroll to the MRT did not faze us. The whole area comes to life at night and is really buzzing. Robertson Quay has lots of bars and restaurants and is a little cheaper than Clarke Quay. Recommend Boomerang for happy hour. We were room only so used a couple of nearby supermarkets to stock up the room with breakfast treats. Free wifi in the room which is super quick. Loved the pool. I hope the photos give you an idea of hotel facilities and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DESIGN EVER, AND HOLIDAY IN GREAT BED”
Reviews.Author: JulietJune
Reviews.Content: i would like to say that this Hotel was a great hotel. The Design of this hotel very nice even it not that big, but the designer know how to make the space enough for the Guest. I enjoy staying over. This is my second time stayed. eventhough at the first stayed in the hotel (May), i lost my things. The special gift. very disappoited. the second time im stay over, no more make up room. however thanks to the management of Studio M.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, small but so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Brissy_Traveller1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in August, after reading the reviews on trip advisor I was a little concerned about what it would be like. I have to say I was throughly impressed with the hotel. The rooms were small but I think they were set out really well. The bed at this hotel was hands down the best in Asia. I am 6'3 and my feet did not hang off the end and it was nice and soft. The hotel is an easy 5 min walk to clarke quay which has heaps of options for dinner and nightlife. The only thing that was really annoying is that there is another hotel called M hotel on Anson rd, and then this hotel called Studio M on Nanson rd.. as the names are so similar a number of times a taxi would take us to the wrong one so you are better off saying Mohamed Sultan Drive to a taxi driver as this is the streeet at the front of the hotel. Also this hotel has free wireless broadband which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “'' TERRIBLE '''”
Reviews.Author: JOHNYDOE
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver took us to the wrong hotel which was a branch of this one It was annoying as we were so tired after long flight.anyway when we finally reached the correct hotel the reception clerk had no record of our bookings which was made thru BOOKING.COM. after getting usa room we had to carry our own luggage to the room as there was no porter around .the room as dusty and the bathroom filty the tiles were growing fungus and there was a stench.The bed linen was clean though. we had an early flight so breakfast was around 7am We arrived in the breakfast room with no staff to be seen although the food was spread out.we helped ourselves to the cold dried tasteless sausages bacon etc which was prepared the night before after a wait staff members were seen walking around we made inquiries about the person who was supposed to be at the egg counter and after a while a person appeared to help us .then came the time to settl the bill..........the charge was $40 more than the price quoted by BOOKING.COM .after an query we we told that the price on the bill was correct we paid with anger and left for the airport Never again will we stay in this hotel nor will we recommend anyone else its not worth the price and the service and staff are pathetic .we booked this hotel based on the location and price but was disappointed a money was wasted .we could hav stayed at another 4* hotel in the city centre if we had known that we would be charged more for a night's accommodation.this hotel needs a new chef and new cleaning staff.to improve its standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, funky and everything you could hope for!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Jax
Reviews.Content: The Studio M Hotel is really fabulous! We were concerned before we arrived as we had booked before it opened and then some of the previous reviews were less than glowing...but we needn’t have worried, it was A* from start to finish! We arrived at the hotel at 9am in the morning, yet the friendly reception staff said that we could have our room if we waited an hour. I think that’s pretty impressive given that check in isn’t until 2pm! We had breakfast/coffee in the lovely Coffee Shop on the ground floor. The quality of the food and drinks was superb and the service was quick and friendly – a great start to our trip. Okay, it wasn’t that cheap, but only like Starbucks prices and much tastier! Once we got into our fabulous room we were delighted! I don’t know how people can moan! Yes, it is compact, but in such a cleverly designed way that you never feel cramped or claustrophobic, the layout is really brilliant. The floor to ceiling windows are stunning and the quirky two level aspect to the room is really unique. We had the bed on the ground floor – and a desk and sofa bed upstairs (which we mainly used for storage/drying clothes/shopping bags etc!) The shower and toilet are in separate “wet room” style cubicles on either side of the entrance door – and previous reviewers really did over exaggerate, they are lovely and plenty big enough! (I am 5ft9 and my boyfriend is 6ft so we’re not small either!) The shower in particular is amazing, with a big marble bench in there to put all your toiletries in – and always plenty of hot, powerful water (which is much needed in Singapore!!) The air conditioning is powerful – but easily and quickly adjustable should you need to change it. You get complimentary water every day too which is a nice touch. The free wi-fi is a very useful too! Rooms were serviced carefully and thoroughly everyday, and everything used was replaced for us. ...Oh and the bed! The comfiest ever!! We slept like logs every single night for the 13 nights we were there, it was a paradise! The pool area is really beautiful – a lovely way to spend an afternoon if you’ve worn yourself out with all the sightseeing! I would say that they should implement some rules for the pool...as there was a rather loud/rowdy Australian family in there a few occasions we tried to go, which spoilt it somewhat for us – and the other families with sweet young children, or other couples – who wanted a bit of calm! But if you get civilized other guests it is wonderful!! Normally, we do not eat in a hotel restaurant on holiday, but my partner was unwell one evening – so I ate there. The food was spectacularly good!! It’s Japanese style, but cooked to perfection and really very good value. The drinks/cocktail menu is excellent too (although a little expensive). I really do recommend trying it out – I had the steak and it was delicious!! All of the staff you encounter – be it on reception, the maid service, the wonderfully helpful concierge, the restaurant/bar staff – are all smiling, attentive and helpful. We did not have a single issue and were treated like kings and queens! They were helpful with both enquiries about the hotel and about Singapore itself and made our stay very pleasant. Only one little tiny thing which makes it a 4 star rather than a 5 is that it is quite a way from the MRT station. We are young and active, so thought the 15 minute walk would not worry us – but Singapore is VERY hot and humid so it does take it out of you a little bit and feels a lot longer than it is! It’s a pleasant, nice walk – but just a bit far (especially at the end of a long day sightseeing!) Also, when we were there, there were loads of events on at Clarke Quay for the Mid Autumn Festival and the Grand Prix – so it was crazy busy trying to get through the crowds every night (took over 30 minutes from the MRT station!) Also 95% of taxi drivers do not know this hotel!!! We were taken to the Hotel M across town on several occasions – even when we gave them the street address!! The only way you can get them to take you to the right place – is to ask for the Gallery Hotel next door and point on a map. However, taxi’s are very reasonable – and it only costs $20 from the airport to the hotel. Definitely give this hotel a try – you will get a contemporary, funky, relaxed hotel – at very reasonable rates. We will stay again without hesitation when we next return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is great, its quite, rooms are better than expected, The price is great and breakfast was sufficient. For the price how can you complain. Around the corner for a short walk to roberston quay and there is heaps nice little cafe style pubs and eateries; a lot lot cheaper than clarke quay. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Visual Feast, Comfy Enough”
Reviews.Author: Chrin
Reviews.Content: Aesthetically quite pleasing, from the lobby to the poolside to the rooms. Contemporary furniture in bold colors add a lot of punch and visual interest. The loft room concept worked well for us (we're medium built), but I can imagine a heavier set person would not fare as well. The bedroom ceiling was relatively low, and the shower and closet areas may get a little cramped. (Case in point: I'm 5'6" and I could touch the ceiling easily without tiptoeing; I also could not fully stretch out my arms on both sides inside the shower area.) For us, it was pretty comfortable and we enjoyed our room. Only downside in our opinion is that its not very near to an MRT station. But if you don't mind a 15 minute walk by the river, then this shouldn't be a problem. I'd recommend this hotel for young adventurous couples. Not for older couples (stairs might be a problem, especially if you have to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night), not for families with little kids (no space to help them in the shower or water closet) or for heavier-set people (space might be a big issue).

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Kittkey
Reviews.Content: I was in two minds about staying here due to some of the negative reviews, but decided to give it a try. This was mainly because the price was so good compared to other hotels with similar facilities / location. I'm very glad I did this as I had a great stay however I can see that the hotel room design might not be to the taste of those who like more traditional decor and layout. The only negative I have to comment on is the evening I arrived hotel staff seemed very thin on the ground. There was no-one in the lobby to help with my heavy suitcase and bags, then later when I wanted some concierge advice about local restaurants the desk was empty. However at all other times during my stay there were adequate and attentive staff. I thought the rooms were cleverly designed with plenty of storage space and drawers, cupboards etc. The mezzanine level provided plenty of extra space and comfy seating / desk but as a lone guest I did not need to use it. I liked the style & decor a lot. The bed was really comfy too. I used the pool everyday and thought the pool side area looked cool, the pool was not too busy either and very clean. I did not eat here but had a very good cocktail in the outdoor bar one evening. Free wifi was very welcome after prior stays in other hotels who charge hefty daily rates. To sum up this is a great hotel where you get a lot for your money. Location is good so long as you don't mind a 10 min walk to the MRT. It's new, clean and the design looks good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, too far from public transport”
Reviews.Author: beachchick82
Reviews.Content: Room - I don't really use the study table as its upstairs... so I felt that I would have preferred it on the same floor, though thats not possible as the room is so small. As for the bed, it is soooooooooo comfortable I feel like it embraces me! I have difficulty waking up every morning!!! Breakfast - is good, although its the same food everyday. The lamb sausage, brie cheese and salad especially. Facilities - pool is good for a few laps, but gym is a bit too dark for my liking. Service - not great. Took me ages to check out. Hotel staff got very confused when I wanted to use 2 different credit cards to pay for room. Location - its just too far from the MRT. Imagine 15-20minutes walk under the sun to Clarke Quay MRT station, with heels and a heavy laptop bag. It isn't fun. I guess the hotel recognises this and provides transportation to key areas in Singapore. However, Studio M is part of a big chain of hotels and is only limited to 6 seats each day. So if you don't book your seat the day before, be prepared to pay SGD10/way each day to work (SGD20 for return). Also, the bus is quite early, at 750am. Conclusion: Ok to stay, but be prepared to take cabs all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Sportbilly121
Reviews.Content: If you do not have the agility of a mountain goat do not stay here, I am an amateur athlete and in excellent shape but I was genuinely concerned making my way around the almost prison cell like rooms. Frankly the design of the rooms is poor (shower beside the door, beds stuffed into a half height ceiling, stairs and desk that integrate .. bizarre). Also be aware that there is no restuarant / room service though plenty in the vicinity. Bit of a hunt (and addt. cost) to find breakfast. Trendy, glorified youth hostel .. that trys hard .. and we all love a tryer. Staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: Feierteifl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for one Week. Service in general was more or less non existent. When we arrived 5 people from staff stood at the counter and no one even cared to help bringing in our luggage. Through the whole stay no one ever was of help, greeted or even looked up from their computers at the counter when we entered or left the building. All together you got the impression, that the staff really doesn't care about their customers or who is going in or out of the building. They rather prefer watching videos on Youku on their iMacs. Luckily the elevators are secured by your key card. Otherwise I would have even been concerned about my valuables in my room. Best part was, that on our third day the fire alarm went off. Through a speaker we were advised to stay calm in our room until the situation has been investigated. After at least half an hour and no further information, we decided to get our most important stuff and exited the building using the fire escape. When we came out, all the staff was standing outside of the Hotel, smoking and chatting and again no one even noticed us. So we went to the front desk and asked about the situation. There we were told, that all of this was just a fire drill which should be over soon. When we asked why they didn't inform us, they just said that we should have gotten a circular the day before. Sadly the maids simply forgot to clean our room the day before, and even when we complained about that, no one thought of telling us about the drill. We didn't even get an excuse from the guy at the front desk, that this has happened. All in all you feel treated like in a youth hostel. Actually I even stayed in youth hostels with better service.... None of the Staff seems to feel responsible for anything there. Regarding the rooms. The design and layout is nice but impracitcal. You don't even have enough space for storing your luggage in the room. The rooms themselves are tiny and at best good for one person. They really are way smaller than it seems on the pictures. Although this Hotel is only open for a few months, it already shows first signs of beeing run down. I won't stay in that hotel a second time and I wouldn't recommend it to anybody. Especially considering the rates of the rooms, service should be way better and the rooms should have more space.

Reviews.Title: “Last mintue booking, so was happy!”
Reviews.Author: LouLou1233
Reviews.Content: I booked this over the internet a day before arriving from KL. which was fine got the booking number by text etc. arrived thinking the worst after coming from KL so it was nice to arrive to a trendy hotel. The porters were great arriving and leaving! My bags and taxi's were taken are off with a smile! The porters deserve a rise! infact put them as the reception staff as they took so long! Reception staff.??..... I was told I needed to have a printed copy of the confirmation of the booking before they could help me?! I said it was done on the internet and I have my booking number by text, they said sorry, you need the piece of paper, not happy, had to call back to australia to get a copy faxed to the hotel! that didn't seem to help anyway, still took along time and they reserved $900 singapore dollars on my creditcard. The girl serving me spoke to the other three girls in her language and they all looked at me and where laughing and putting their hands to thier faces laughing? i asked if there was something wrong? she said that thier computer system was down? and asked if I had paid and how much? did it include tax???? and what room I booked? uummm lucky I am honest, it was all in the piece of paper I HAD FAXED!!! finally worked out, got to the room, yes small, but it was clean, trendy and great location. it was a 10 min walk to orchard rd (shopping malls) and 10 mins along the river to Clarkes Quay where you can get the train. its along the river where you can have seat or a drink or meal along the river, or even a cruise, i perfer there than right in the heart of the city. I was happy with room, did get fresh towels and water and anything I used was replaced. it wasn't vaccumed, but the bed sheets were changed each day, aircon was fine, view was great, loved the big windows, the loft design, the decor. Very happy and would stay again. good price singapore $640 for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Scotsmaninmalaysia
Reviews.Content: Check in quite acceptable; took our own suitcases to our room - nice not to have fuss of bellboy. Room small but space management excellent - good storage. Bed very comfortable, air con no problem at all. Floor are very small but there is a usable mezzanine level fitted out with a work area if you want it. And a fold out 3rd single bed/chair if you wanted to squeeze in 3. But 3 adults would be pushing it. Shower room small but good hot shower. Bathroom tiny and a bit of a pong from the drain. Excellent pool and gym. Breakfast good for the price - and included in the Agoda rate, whereas many places would charge extra Sing$10-20 for a brekkie. Breakfast area can get crowded. Good location on the river and adjacent to many nice bars and restaurants, and 5-10m walk from Clarke Quay. 15m walk to Clarke Quay MRT station, but its a nice walk. Excellent "Book Cafe" right across the road. Go there instead of inhouse Illy place. If you dont need a big fancy room but want a modern room with a good sleep and shower, this is hard to beat in Singapore for the price.

Reviews.Title: “after two week stay we thought....”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller97
Reviews.Content: lovely designer rooms as others have raised. very functional. loved the huge windows for views and natural light. service is very patchy - some excellent, some far from it - but thats Singapore. concierge(s) was very helpful. sleep quality & free wifi was excellent but the aircon as mentioned was tricky to get right. 25m Lap pool & well setup gym (outside & well ventilated but not aircon). so as not to repeat the same comments over we'll add our tips for the area: Japanese supermarket under the Liang centre is a must for top-ups and supplies and excellent quality sushi (which is marked down at ~7.30pm each day for a picnic on the river for cheapskates). MRT stations Clarke Quay or Chinatown are walking distance.15-20min or about $4 in taxi. MRT to airport for ~$2.50 is good value, otherwise taxi ~ $28. good walking & jogging track on river out the front. Boat Quay Number 56 great Chinese food at very good prices right on River (we're told by the locals that people sitting on the river tables pay more than those on the "shop" side of the footpath. New Illy coffee shop in hotel foyer passable quailty coffee but staff not so great. Drinks are heavily taxed in singapore so expensive (even in supermarkets) - the bargain of the week is Wednesday ladies night all over singapore where ladies get into clubs for free and get free drink vouchers - party all night for next to nothing. great yum cha on sundays at Red Star in Chinatown - worth the queue - v near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business, more show than substance”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Check-in was slow, carried my bags to my room. Room as per other reviews was snug. Bathroom was tiny but adequate for single traveller not intent on living in the bathroom. Had upstairs bed, two lcd tvs in a room that would not have felt out of place on a cruise ship (small, confined). Location is ok but taxis not easy to get in the evening. Room had been cleaned but a few things missed (hair on the floor). Would not recommend for more than one person and definitely not for those with kids (or traveller likely to engage in alcohol consumption) as stairs to bed was an accident waiting to happen. Internet sevice was free but very slow. May look hip and cool but there are cooler, cheaper and more comfortable places to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “safety should be a priority”
Reviews.Author: haikugenji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from July 30 to August 1. All in all it was a pleasant stay but we strongly advise the staff to be more proactive with safety measures. My daughter slipped and fell hitting her hip on the 2nd floor bathroom because of a puddle she failed to notice because of the white tiles. If she had hit her head, this accident could have been fatal or debilitating. This was reported to the Front Desk and after the perfunctory "Do you want to see a doctor?" nothing else was heard from them. It would be a waste to see this hotel being heralded as unsafe. I only wish they would at least have shown more concern and given us more feedback. My daughter immediately reported her accident to the 2nd floor crew because she feared for an elderly woman on a cane who was next in line to go the bathroom. She did not even get a thank you for saving the hotel from further accidents .

Reviews.Title: “do not bother”
Reviews.Author: lou_lou_in_hk
Reviews.Content: should have believed the bad reviews. we are sorry we didnt. we stayed for SGD156/night, adds up to SGD550 for 3 nights of poor sleep and cleanliness. it's a small room even for asian couples. location - far from any public transport - easy to catch a cab anytime outside the hotel - most cab drivers do not know where it is, need to show them the way check-in & check-out - they needed names and credit card imprint. that took 15 minutes in the middle of the night with no other guests needing service - long q observed in their lobby most of the day - we saw no apologies from staff for serving another person not in q first, a lady had to tell the staff that she was there first - there was no bar fridge, but check-out still took another 15 minutes. room - bed is upstairs like they should be only in the premium rooms. we got the regular room with the bed downstairs. sofa and table were inconveniently upstairs. - poor aircon placement like previously mentioned: vent directly above head, we had to choose between cold air blowing on head or stuffy warm room. - no aircon/ventilation in toilet or shower room. so, if the sliding door is closed, the shower room remains damp/stuffy after shower - obvious cigarette burn marks at the edge of sink of this new hotel - good water pressure. cant say the same for drainage - poorly fitted toilet seat amenities - we took a cotton bud out of plastic casing provided in the toiletries box and chucked the half open box back in the shelf. we returned the next day to find the chambermaid shoved the remainer cotton buds and opened plastic casing back into the toiletries box for us. - dirty: previous guests' used yellow mosquito patch was stuck behind of shower door for the 3 nights we stayed there - the pillows were uncomfortable, but the sheets and bed were good - carpet was damp when we got into the room. we had to call and ask for bathroom slippers. - need to join the q and pay SGD5 deposit for an adapter pool was nice, but couldn't redeem the place.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and good”
Reviews.Author: fhirner
Reviews.Content: As Singapore's hotels are mostly very expensive the Studio M Hotel is a recommendation. Price is around 100 Euros / night which is quite low. Located at the Quay's in the CBD it offers nice and modern rooms and a very good pool. Hotel is quite new so facilities are up-to-date. Unfortunately the breakfast buffet is more than poor compared to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: PenguinGeneral
Reviews.Content: Rooms are too small and not user friendly. Lights are not well planned and difficult to use as they all turn on at the same time. Bathrooms are tight and feel like closets. Loft concept is a bad idea, I guess the hotel owner was trying to save money and cram as many rooms as possible into the limited space and try to call it hip instead of tiny. Very limited staff and too too educated. Takes forever to check in or to get anything done. The only upside was the free WiFi. I will not recommend this hotel to a friend or colleague. For a budget hotel, I guess better to stay somewhere else>

Reviews.Title: “A Brand New Chic and Stylish SOHO Style Hotel located In The Heart of A Chillout Area”
Reviews.Author: benakm
Reviews.Content: I first came to know about this hotel before its grand opening recently when a friend of mine posted his photos of his stay in this hotel during a weekend. That's when I said wow, I must certainly visit this boutique hotel at least once. The moment i stepped into the lobby, i was amazed just by looking at the chic interior design and furnishing. After receiving the keys to my room, upon stepping out of the lift, I was greeted with a narrow passage with clear glass views of the surrounding and the hotel swimming pool on level 6. It's simply amazing. Once i opened the door to my room, it was as imagined, a SOHO type of studio apartment with a mini pantry corner, a business desk and small bench with open concept closet. The room is a split level designed concept with brilliant contrast of colours. The bed is located on the second floor. Not a big room in fact, but cosy enough for a relaxing stay. The bed is VERY Comfortable. Definitely one of the best beds I have slept. So soft and fluffy. My sleep quality was amazing! The bed and pillows are comparable to another boutique hotel I stayed in New Zealand, Hotel SO. Can't say much for the customer service as I only stayed one night. The hotel is brand new with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesleywakeling
Reviews.Content: We arrived at approx 4.00 p.m. We had a long wait for check in, desk staff not adequately trained, took forever. There were 5 in our group. We had booked a superior room and a studio loft. Were allocated two studio loft rooms despite paying for a superior room, when staff were alerted of this after some discussion, we were allocated a "superior room" (no different to studio loft except for the bed configuration). The superior room was booked for 3 adults, there was no second bed made up, no provision for towels etc for 3. Had to ask front desk several times to make up divan and arrange for additional towels to be provided. This was done after some time. However, the cleaning staff never left 3 towels after cleaning, it took several days for that to sink in, BUT we were never left 3 teabags or coffee sachets. We had to leave a note for the cleaning staff to remind them that there were 3 occupants of the room, we did finally get the right number of towels, however not tea or coffee. One day we even got a towel that had a big hole in it and a tear. The rooms are not hoovered every day, we had the same crumbs in the same location on the floor for 3 days running, The rooms are small, not suitable for any more than 2 persons and not large ones!!. The shower and toilet are really small, once the divan bed is made out, there is no room downstairs for any type of movement, do not take large suitcases, no sufficient room for those! We had to leave a deposit of $200.00 per person, we were not advised of this at time of booking. The service of the front desk is not good, more training needs to be given especially on PR issues. Key card did not work on several occasions, had trouble getting it re-programmed, the desk staff blamed a mobile phone for the card not working, however the guest did not have a mobile phone. It had to be re-set 4 times during a 10 night stay. Shuttle Coach driver pleasant and helpful, staff who arranged taxi's etc also pleasant and helpful as were the porters. It would seem that the front desk is where most of the issues lay. Definitely more training or new staff that are competent We asked about booking tours, the front desk were unable to help, there is no tours that can be booked from that hotel, they have no information on any of the attractions available in Singapore, no information on tour operators either. No promotion of Singapore at all. Overall a bad experience that I will not repeat, next time I will book another hotel that caters for all my needs such as tours, friendly and efficient staff and more room to move in. Our holiday was not a good experience accommodation wise. Singapore a great holiday location but Studio M not a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “won't be back”
Reviews.Author: pc_holiday
Reviews.Content: This was booked by my travel agent for my one night stop over, but seeing the reviews about the small rooms made me a bit apprehensive. It pretty much met my expectations - small! I was by myself and good thing too otherwise it could push travel stress to breaking point. On the toilet seat my knees got close to touching the wall. The ceiling mounted Air con unit blows from only a couple of metres away directly onto the bed (that was the worst aspect of this hotel) and the TV can only be seen from the bed. There was no view (apart from people in the adjacent wing of the hotel), though it didn;t matter alot to me as it got dark shortly after getting in. The breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could do better”
Reviews.Author: sukri_karim2000
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice concept with the stairs going to the loft bed...feel like a penthouse condo...bed is comfortable and 2 flatscreen TVs...the pub is nice and i got to watch world cup game Cons: (1)Room service is not available and no much choice to order at the restaurant...feel like a no frills hotel for a quite pricy rate (2) no one picked up my call to the front desk...try to get extra hangers...4 hangers not enough for biz traveler like me...(3) bathroom is too small, difficult to open the door and get out from the room

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite hotels that I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pedrothelion77
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to 31 different countries, and this hotel was one of my favorite that I have ever stayed at. I don't understand the complaints from a lot of the reviews. Very cool concept, nice location, cool vibe. I noticed a lot of the guests were in their 20's and early 30's, and this is who I think would enjoy this hotel. Also, I would recommend the hotel for 1, 2, or maybe 3 people at the most. Yes, the space is not huge in the room, but it is still very nice in the loft. Free wi-fi, nice pool, nice fitness centre, good location (I don't know how people complain about walking 10 minutes to a MTR stop, it's good for your health).

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy rooms, bad service”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: We knew what to expect when we booked a room (premier loft) at Studio M, but were pleasantly surprised when we saw the room - while it was small, it was very clean, compact and comfortable. The free wireless Internet was a big plus for us. The air-conditioning can be rather strong, especially where it blows directly at the bed. If you are lucky, you may get a parking space (usually available during the off peak hours) in the building but otherwise, you can park at the opposite building and claim the parking fees from Studio M, and only once. Our only complaint is the service at the reception - all the staff at the check-in and check-out counter were quite rude, curt and gave no eye-contact whatsoever to the guests. Something has got to be done about this, as while we enjoyed our stay at Studio M, we do not look forward to having to deal with such unfriendly reception staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Pros: Great room to sleep 3 people. Good...”
Reviews.Author: SlaveToShopping
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great room to sleep 3 people. Good value. Pool area very nice. Great location near Robertson and Clarke Quay. Cons: Rooms very small. Checkin takes forever - allow 20 minutes. Bar area on 2nd floor looks nice but prices are extortion. We will stay again on our way back through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Recovery”
Reviews.Author: justincredible1
Reviews.Content: I have experienced some of the issues mentioned in the other reviews on this Hotel until... I spoke to Management and my issues were resolved. Service at that level was outstanding! It's amazing what the hotel have done with the use of space in rooms. The public areas: pool, bar, restaurant all very good Second time round--left very happy

Reviews.Title: “Great idea - needs a little refining”
Reviews.Author: TheCollies
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my husband, infant and inlaws for 4 nights. My in-laws thought the concept of the rooms was great and was perfect for their needs. We both had the premium lofts so a small lounge on the ground floor and bed upstairs. Our main issue was that when we contacted the hotel about a cot we were told we would only find out if one was available when we arrived at the hotel which is no good. Where would the baby sleep if one is not available? Lots of people have complained about the size of the toilet and shower room. The toilet was the perfect size for what we had to do in there and it was nice to have a wet room rather than a shower. There is a bench in the shower which is good as I could sit the baby on my knee to wash her and not worry about her slipping. There are definately a few teething issues for the hote which I am sure will be sorted out in the coming months, mainly to do with house keeping, not the cleaning which we could not fault but things like leaving us with no toilet roll and forgetting to replace tea and coffee. However on our floor the store room was left open every day so we could help ourselves. We did get a fantastic deal as we booked before the hotel was opened so we got great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms with bad locaion”
Reviews.Author: MZTK
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a small city, so once you hop on the train; it only takes some minutes for the main places for tourists. If you are a business and just staying around Clarke Quay then this might be good. But if you are new in town, just stay at City Hall area. 20minutes to the station and the staff can’t point out the destination. Rooms are tiny like Hamster cages, new hotel good in design. No windows to open, so the smell of the paint is staying with you together. It will take months for the smell to run. The pool, Gym, Café, Restaurant, and garden are in the same open area so you will have no privacy. You will see that when having breakfast. Breakfast is nothing special, with small amount to choose, its in the open area, so by the time of 7:00am the butter and cheese are melting, along with brown salad leafs. The rooms are very small for every one, the internet doesn’t work. I saw a photo of a 3 person group staying together…..HOW DO THEY GO INSIDE? The midnight staffs are really good. I think the qualified staff who can handle anything by their own is shifted to midnight. The daytime staffs have no skills. If you have travelled frequently and slept in great places, then Studio M is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service, cool concept, tiny space”
Reviews.Author: Eelayel
Reviews.Content: Booked the Studio Loft. Room is very small, once you walk in you will see the bed. Not more than 10 steps to the bed. Toilet and shower stall is also restrictive and tiny, not for European or US travellers. For a new hotel, the door to the shower stall was damaged. The space saving room reminds me of the budget hotels in Tokyo where amenities are minimal. Only 3 pathetic bottles of shower gel, shampoo and conditioner, nothing in the minibar fridge & washing sink is outside from the toilet and shower stall, nowhere to hang the towel in the shower stall.
