There were dust on the round lamp. The study area can double up as an extra sleeping area when you pull the sofa out to form a rather awkward bed. This would make an ideal bedroom for a single, but not so ideal for a hotel room for more than 2 persons. More suitable for the typical single business traveller who does not need much space. Pool area is nice, but pool is very small and easily overcrowded. plenty of deck chairs for people to sun bath and people watching. 1.2m in depth and 25m in length. There were more people talking about how nice the Gallery Hotel's pool than actually using the hotel's pool because it is so small. Breakfast was also a letdown Service was extremely disappointing. Check-in took longer than it should, most of the time spent on waiting. Housekeeping took more than half an hour to deliver towels. Staff were very unhelpful when asked whether there was a iPhone charger or iPhone docking for charging the phone. They seems to be biased against Singaporeans staying over the weekend for staycation.

Reviews.Title: “a cute hotel but poor service”
Reviews.Author: macauaznchick
Reviews.Content: the hardware is super nice and impressive except the soft part of the hotel; the staff was not responsive to our needs and it took forever for them to bring me an extra pair of slippers. after our check-out, the hotel staff just ignored us and we had to carry our on luggage.....

Reviews.Title: “Model hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: OzTrav2
Reviews.Content: Cool new modern hotel with trendy loft style rooms. Rooms were a little small but would suit solo and couples. The hotel location is a moderate walk from public transport however is based on Robertson / Clarke Quay which is great for restaurants/bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not to try this terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkmoosebee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Singapore. Please DO NOT even try to stay for one night. Service is so terrible. It takes forever to get service from any departments.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: TandTSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: When I saw the advertisment on the internet, I thought this might be a nice option for some days in Singapore, but unfortunately I was completely wrong! Positive: - The hotel is brand new, the rooms have a modern trendy and nice decor - The location can be good if you like to be close to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay (however you are far from public transportation and also far from some of the main sightseeing spots and as walking is sometimes difficult due to humidity you have to take taxis often from / to the hotel) Negative: - Absolutely zero service: when I tried to make the reservation via phone, no one picked up the phone, so I made the reservation online (but could not get any further info about the hotel). Once there, nobody helped with the luggage; when I called the hotel from outside to speak to my friend nobody picked up the phone again; when I asked for help with booking of a restaurant, they were not able to help (they have no clue about restaurants in Singapore!). Check Out took me more than 1 hour, the queue was huge and there were not enough staff at the front desk - The only have 3 elevators for 300 rooms, so this means you wait always long - The rooms are tiny like a shoe box. Yes they are duplex on 2 floors and there is a high ceiling, but the 2 floors are so tiny that you almost can't move around. The toilet and the shower are both in a tiny box, but there is not really a bathroom, the sink is in the room, so really no space for anything - Pool and gym are very basic, only 10 sunchairs for 300 rooms, the whole area looks already filthy (altough they opened only 3 months ago!) For me the hotel looks like a trendy youth hostel, unfortunately the price is a bit higher than a youth hostel - and besides I did not want to stay in a youth hostel! There are much better hotels for the same price, so this is definitely a no-go!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for single travellers or couples only. Not appropriate for families.”
Reviews.Author: MrsSHCMC
Reviews.Content: * Modern design. *Good location. *Very small rooms - toilet and shower are very very small! *Suitable for single travellers or couples only. Not appropriate for families. *Lovely pool, outdoor lounge area. *Service was very average. For example - 1) requested extra bedding and was told to wait 40 minutes because staff were unavailable (this was at 11pm at night). 2) Asked for an international adaptor. We were told they did not have any international adaptors and that we should purchase one at the 7/11 down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Modern but too small,”
Reviews.Author: adventureperth
Reviews.Content: I took a chance when i booked this hotel as it was still not open and with no reviews. In description it read double bed with a double sofa bed. Well the rooms are so small that u can bearly fit one suticase. no wardrobe but a 40 cm rod hanging above the suitcase space. toilet ! can not feet any person over 5, 5", my knees were touching the opposite wall and I am under that. showers have no space for hanging towels, so u have to step out ,which would be next to the bed! and grab the towel of the bed and no space to hang the wet one!! They do not provide a sheet for over bed, so u have a sheet over mattress and one duna, if u ask for more, it causes lots of issues, the sofa bed on our arrival was nto made and we had lots of issues ordering some sheets to cover the spare blankets! took them 45 minutes and 3 phone calls to get sheets sent up! Even the hotel directory is a maze, tell u for manager use function 3, however God knows what is function 3, definately not dialing no 3! yes tried that. Airconditioing given for such small space was quite out of wack too cold or too warm as it would blow directly above sofa and the bed.

Reviews.Title: “NOT recommended for longer than 3 days”
Reviews.Author: mimima
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business, two weeks. Crowd is mix of Westerners on business and Malays, Chinese, on holiday. Few Japanese and Koreans as well. This hotel is new and hence NOT PREPARED!! Examples: Key card had to be changed 4 times in two weeks, the LOCK TO THE ROOM broke and had to have room change, house keeping is erratic (at times sufficient, at times not leaving towels, no toilet paper!!, ) they even missed to clean my room twice. NOT things you want to call for and deal with at end of the day. Breakfast is badly serviced. It is outside only, very humid, esepcially if you are in work clothes. Not enough staff, tables are not cleaned off, forks missing, no glasses etc. NOT things you want to deal with first thing in the morning. Front desk often did not answer the call and put on hold for up to 7 minutes!! No room service as advertised. No MRT station near by so must take taxi everywhere. All staff are not trained up to speed yet and some even have an attitude. Probably ok and acceptable for a short stay. NOT recommended for more than 3 days!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel with not the best of rest/bathroom facilities”
Reviews.Author: dangboy
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city, and offers a duplex kind of setting for the study, the space allocated for both the restroom and bathroom is so small that it can hardly make a person sit or stand comfortably.. Am not able to understand the reason behind this limited space and design for it, even though one doesn't visit them often in a day, but even then a short visit for 5-10 minutes should be comfortable enough which is not in this case.

Reviews.Title: “cute loft.. REALLY UNPREPARED staff and service”
Reviews.Author: greenpeasforlove
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend stay at the Studio M hotel, expecting all sorts of lovely things - the pictures of the studio loft were too cute! Well, everything good pretty much ended there. When we opened the door, we were greeted by an overwhelming whiff of STRONG STALE SMOKE smell (despite it being a non-smoking hotel and the cleaner told us she just tidied up the room for us), we called the reception to alert them of this anomaly and they finally sent someone up to check on it. The service staff himself claimed to be a smoker and was shocked by how strong the smell was - well, that makes 3 of us. He switched on the air purifier machine and told us this wasn't good for our bodies (over-ionises/purifies the body it seems) so we should get out for a while. We did. When we got back after an hour, expecting the room to be CLEAN, NICE-SMELLING and COLD (since we left the a/c on), the smell was gone no doubt (in a sterilised industrial cleaner way) but the room was HOT (29.5 degrees celsius to be specific). The a/c was spoilt. Anyway to cut a long story short - it took them 5 visits to the room (technician and whatnots) asking us to "wait for the air to circulate" for 45mins to an hour at a shot. After the 3rd try, we were incredibly frustrated (and waiting to go out for dinner) thus we requested for a room switch. Asliza (?) the receptionist told us firmly that there were no more rooms available (hotel was fully booked), said theres nothing they could do (with NO inkling of apology AT ALL) and requested for us to wait till the technician arrived (he eventually did at 9pm - how ridiculous is that?? It was a sauna for the entire day). So we left him to fix it, stepped out for dinner, came back at about 11+pm and THE BLOODY A/C WAS STILL NOT WORKING. Called the front desk (they changed shift - thank GOD) and after the technician conceded defeat at 12 MIDNIGHT - we finally got a room change (yes, in that fully booked hotel room). This was something they could have done A LONG WHILE AGO instead of forcing us to spend the entire day in a sauna or asking us to "step out for a while while the a/c resumes" (for 4 times) - WHO BOOKS A HOTEL ROOM TO SPEND THE ENTIRE DAY OUT??? We finally got a half decent room post 12midnight - HOW TERRIBLE IS THAT? And I haven't even started on the lack of amenities, how SMALL the bathroom and toilet is (yes, separated - smaller than one normal cubicle each). The last straw that broke the camel's back was the INSANELY LONG checkout queue at 12pm. We took about an hour to get to the front of the queue. It was THAT slow. Thanks to unprepared staff (only 2 at the front desk, both serving only 1 customer at one time). And the horrible attitude Asliza (?) showed when she realised we got a room change thanks to her understanding colleague. It probably caused her 5 seconds of inconvenience in checking out and she showed it - by tsking and slamming papers down on the table. Not obvious but we were most certain not oblivious. Parking was another pain. They had a pathetic number of parking lots for the number of patrons (<20 for hundreds of patrons?? They could have planned better.). They advised us to park across the street and told us it was only 2bucks. Turned out it was yes, 2bucks for 7pm-12midnight. And 2bucks for every hour from 12midnight to 6am. So we paid an additional 16bucks. NO attempts to reimburse us for our inconvenience. DISAPPOINTING. Never going back there again. Whatever concept the hotel was going for (ie I really liked the pool and the poolside bar concept) was COMPLETELY marred by the horrible service of a few in the staff team and the unpreparedness of the hotel as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Great short term hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillN55
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel with a great pool & lounge area in a great location on Robertson Quay. The loft concept is interesting. All very compact. Toilet is a bit small and I could not put my feet on the ground, even though I’m 6ft! The seat is too high! Good quality bed. Did not try the restaurant, but there are plenty of restaurants along the river, a very short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not one that I would recommend , Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Celiasng
Reviews.Content: It's a last min family trip with not much choice at all . We know it's a new hotel so we didnt expect much but the quality of service is still below standard . There were whole lots of staffs in suit at the lobby when we arrived by taxi but none of them offer us a helping hand to open the door even we got lots of lagguages in hand . Bad Impression on the first place. Staffs are rather cool , If they could give us just a warm little smile at the reception i might have a better first impression . The room is small , two "storey" with the bed n tv on the "upper floor" , No standard bathroom , juz a "shower room" on the left handside of the room door n a very small toilet room on the right , the size of the toilet room is even smaller than a public toilet ! n who wants to use a toilet with the wall right in front of yr face ? very poor design ! The bed is too soft , when you turn n sleep at the edge , your hand can touch the floor . N the Sofa bed has a bad design too , people would probably get hurt if they didnt pay attension . The room is quite dusty , and poor house keeping . One bottle of showe gel , shampoo and conditional are given for each room but when we came back the second night , they removed the empty bottles without replacing new ones , we called n asked for replacement and we have to wait for 20 mins for it . No one clean up the rubbish bin on the first day (which is so unbelievable!) and the first night we found the kettle was broken which water leaked out so we called the reception and asked for replacement . wt we got in reply -- "It's after 00:00 so we cant replace it for you now , we will do it tmr " ..aint it suppose to be 24 hours serivce ? The second day .. they simply took away the broken kettle and gave us two extra bottles of water .. wow , problem fixed isnt it ? and the third day they didnt put the kettle back or give us extra water either . Simple , a rather bad hotel experience for the family , we would NOT come back and would NOT recommed it for anyone .

Reviews.Title: “tiny and cramped with not much service....”
Reviews.Author: kodyandko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Studio M hotel whilst in singapore celebrating a friends birthday and ended up checking out after 2 nights.... Whilst i can appreciate the uniqueness and the concept, etc, i think the rooms are more like cabins on a sleeper train than a comfortable hotel room. Everthing is packed in tight, so much so that i just couldnt get comfortable in my room..... ohhh yes the bed is comfortable, but dont get up too fast in the middle of the night as you will probably bang your head on the low roof... and make sure you turn the lights on before you make your way downstairs to the bathroom ... as one wrong step (which is possible after one too many singapore slings) you will fall face first down steep skinny staircase...... There was nothing luxurious or comfortable about my room...........whist the entrance is alive and has a fun vibe... the room i stayed in was dull, boring and bland. I appreciate that i was there (even though i was not told this when booking) during their soft opening stage... but the service was slow and in most cases i was given the answer no to most things i requested for , ie. i asked for an adaptor.... couldnt get one.... i asked for champagne glasses.... was told no we dont have them.... it wasnt untill i insisted they send someone over to their sister property 10 minutes down the road that they agreed they could provide me with champagne glasses. Wish i could comment on the restaurant, gym, cafe etc, that they tout on the website... sadly all closed when we visited..... sorry to say the service was average and we checked out 2 nights into our 4 night stay - went to a trusty bigger chain where i knew i could get champagne glasses if i asked for them. wish studio m much luck .... but they have a long long long way to go ps. if your thinking of taking your partner to studio m for a romantic weekend.... think again... its about as romantic as a concrete paver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: M111111
Reviews.Content: A nice new hotel in a great spot. Good if you want to spend days outside and just sleep there. - Great location - in the city centre, a few minutes walk from hundreds of bars and restaurants by the river, around 10 min walk from MRT - Rooms are very small but nice and clean (if you caompare actual size with pictures from the website you may wonder how they did those pictures...) - Boring breakfasts if you stay longer than a few days - Useless reservation staff - I waisted 2 weeks on emails and calls with them, but this was during soft opening stage so probably will be sorted soon - Ok swimming pool and small gym outside - Nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not when more than 2 people”
Reviews.Author: Pastasauce
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is best suited for 1 or 2 people (sleeping in the same bed). We paid extra for the premiere suite which, apparently fits 4 people but practically, doesn't fit more than 2. The sofa, which opens to a single bed, doesn't cone with sheets or a blanket. When we asked for some, the concierge said it doesn't come with the room. My mom protested and eventually a maid came with a sheet and a pillow. Once again we asked for a blanket and pillows and she said she had to check since the room doesn't come with them. Someone finally brought us a blanket and being that we were three in the room, it took 4 attempts to get a third towel delivered. Our second night we asked for a sheet and another blanket but they ended up bringing us 6 pillow cases instead. The pool to the hotel hasn't opened yet but it seems they were testing it's soundsydtem at 7am this morning. We were on the 6th floor and it was blaring in our room. The whole experience wasn't very nice. I think they have a few growing pains to get through before I'd reccommend it. Ps. They have a sister hotel call Hotel M on Anson road- not to be confused with this one... Studio M on Nanson road. Taxis were confused.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept in a great city location”
Reviews.Author: steve_hew
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in the newly opened Studio M Hotel with a few friends - we had some problems getting there in a taxi but that was to be expected with it being so new. Interesting room concept as described by previous reviewers. At first I was unsure about a number of features / lack of storage etc but a quick exploration revealed an adequate amount of storage for clothes and a sliding door to which sealed off the bathroom / shower area from the rest of the open plan room. My only issue was the need to be very careful coming down the stairs from the bed -esp if you have enjoyed some wine! The hotel is located in the Robertson quay area - a very short walk from Clarke quay which is great for clubs, bars & restaurants, but there are numerous cafes, bars and restaurants beside the hotel which are great value for money. Free wi-fi but seems to be capped at a low bandwidth rate (100kps). Breakfast was good but the coffee machine was a bit of a nuisance. Most of the staff we met were very helpful and friendly. We did encounter a few small problems but to be expected with the newly opened status of the hotel. I would really like to get back again once the bar and pool are open - would definitely recommend to anyone planning a leisure visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crotats
Reviews.Content: This Hotel just opened a few days before I arrived, so price was extremely attractive. This is not your standard Hotel, its very modern, my room was on 2 levels, bed upstairs, TV was also there, downstairs, bathroom, shower and a large desk which was great for working. Everything is conveniently placed. This is a great place and there are a few facilities not yet available, such as the Lap Pool and the Gym. What really sets it apart, Staff is very friendly and helpful and if things do not work it is not a problem they will try to resolve same quickly. Location is great for those which like some nightlife there are also some great al fresco Restaurants just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A place you feel like a home !”
Reviews.Author: tracom
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel on weekend in March 2010.The staffs are friendly .The location is excellent with short distance to chinatown and city.There are bars and restaurants nearby the hotel. We were staying in Studio Loft room which is gorgeous.The bed is comfortable,high glass window which give the brightness of the room.The room is duplex where the bed on the ground floor and desk on second level. The only problem is the bathroom and toilet are small and not much movement.Recommended for couple and business people.
